I have to at least give it respect for doing that. Not only did this movie utterly infuriate me because of the way they betrayed and tortured poor Nick Cage before they roasted him alive but made me understandably ticked off at the whole female species for the way they played off his kind heart. Now that its been a few days since I experienced the movie and my passion has died down I no longer hate women and their potential deceit. I would be silly to compare all women to those evil witches. And again I am judging this movie not on how the story ended but on the degree of emotion I felt after the credits. I honestly don't know if I would recommend this movie to any of my friends only to protect them. The funny thing is the guy that recommended it to me said that it totally ticked him off and warned me that it would do the same. I guess I can't blame anyone but myself.... Grrr...

column4: What were the agents for these phenomenal actresses thinking?
column5: Holy Celtic(?) Cow? Once upon a time the Romans set about conquering the "known" world. Once they established a set "civilised" city for any given area they demonized any pre-established civilisation they conquered. Hence the whole concept of the Wicker Man - a completely unsubstantiated legend.The theory might have worked here however. But for the fact that the editing butchered anything even remotely relating to a plot.Shortly after Nicolas Cage's character entered the "bar" I informed my husband that the plot was obvious. He asked me why. I told him the ending but that I hoped it was a fantasy of some kind based on the whole fire symbolism and a potential comatose resolution. It was so sad that it wasn't.How fabulous that the stellar female cast seemed to bank on the apparently original script which clearly had the potential needed for everyone to sign on. Let's face it these are the actresses of our time. How unfortunate however that the editors producers or whoever butchered this piece of cinema were allowed access. You all should have backed off and allowed this to be what it could have been instead of the "oh dear what on earth could we end this with let's pick this one based on viewer comments even though we set it for another ending which could have explained at least *something* in the opening car crash bit" You know what this viewer is done.

Loved the film! Love films that send chills down your spine. Great acting and directing. Every scene of this film builds upon the one before it. It's a film worth seeing twice to watch it knowing everything. Cage is great in this role and gives credibility to every scene as we identify with him on every level. Some of the other actors faces are still with me and I saw the film a long time ago. I have to see it again. Those who are blasting this movie aren't real film buffs. I don't want to give anything away but I hadn't seen the original and really was able to enjoy this one as if it were really happening to me through Nicholas Cage.

column4: It's so awful that it's worth watching
column5: I understand why people think this is awful because I realize a lot of scenes were completely pointless and completely useless. Nicolas Cage has the worst performance in this movie and I've been looking forward to that because his craziness is so entertaining. The script for this movie is not suspenseful dramatic or good. All it was an awful movie with so many scenes that are completely useless and don't even make any sense but I enjoyed this movie because of Nicolas Cage's craziness and the awful lines that were so hilarious like "How did it get burned" "Not the bees AHHHH!!!" and the most greatest line in this movie is "Oh my God." Yeah this is an awful film but it's worth watching so if you want to watch something awful and enjoyable I think you should give The Wicker Man Remake a watch it's totally worth it.

Don't see it! If you do see prepare for a very unhappy ending.there is a time and place for an ending like that. the reason it was no good is simple: if i read a short story that ended like this i would say "Good tale! kind of pointless but OK a story of horror/evil of mankind." if i read a novel that had a sympathetic character like that die so meaninglessly i would be angry. now if they die for a thematic reason that is one thing. but ed/nicks death is meaningless. it does not take a 2 hour setup to show that life is cruel or bad.if i am watching an independent film i am less prone to demand some sort of meaning or payoff. nihilism the cruelty of people stupid religions etc are all good themes. but not in this movie.this movie has no payoff. the ending is a turnoff. if i am watching a tales of the crypt movie i know to expect. but part of the tale telling of tales of the crypt is that a skeleton with bad jokes tells you a horror tale. so if it is graphic or if it is unjust you knew that.a good storyteller would not take that long to weave such a nothing little tale. this would be also OK as a twilight zone episode. only 30 minutes and sometimes twilight zone got dark. i paid 3.99 and i want my money back.if ed had been a willing sacrifice it could have been cool. but what is the point of an island full of evil crazies who entrap and kill one man for their own needs? even if those crazed pagans had to kill him their smugness and joy at his death was annoying. yes there are people like that. yes some tribal groups do that. yes people in America used to love lynchings. does not mean i want to see it.this movie was emotional smut. and that is no good. i like real real smut sometimes. but some people don't. so if you try and sell a movie that is actually dirty pictures with naked people but convince people who don't like that to see it don't be surprised if they get upset.i kept thinking: somehow someway he either won't die or there will be a meaning to his death.watching this movie was like watching a lynching of an innocent man. who wants to watch that? Don't see it!!!

column4: Not even sure I'd rent this movie
column5: I really hate coming home from a movie and feeling like I wished I hadn't gone. I can usually find something at least entertaining in many movies but The Wicker Man isn't one of them. From terrible acting to a boring story line it's an event best missed.I was fairly excited to see the movie based on my knowledge of the story and from the trailers. It's unfortunate though that you truly see the best parts of the story in the 60 second trailers. Save yourself the money and just watch it from the Apple trailer site.The film was chock full of too many events you could simply predict the outcome of. Too many turns statements "he's gonna get himself locked in there" type of things.Yes it was that bad - and apparently Nick Cage forgot he can act.

Another remake. This one is a remake of a 1976 film that is according to the rating it got on the IMDb rather good. I've never seen it so I can't comment on that.Anyway. In this film Nicolas Cage plays a pained cop that gets a letter from a woman he almost married. She tells him her daughter is missing and asks him to find her. He sets out to find the girl and ends up on a private island where he encounters a strange community existing almost solely of women.It is within that community that he must now find his daughter. And it is within this community that he finds things are not what they look like and that they are actually a lot worse.Again I have never seen the original film but I am interested in seeing that now. This remake is a worthless one but the idea is nice enough. This remake is worthless because it has some severe plot holes. For the rest it isn't all bad but I wouldn't suggest anyone to watch this.3 out of 10 failed pagan rituals

The Wicker Man is not too bad although the original is way better than this. The island is named the same except in a different location and instead of pagan worshippers we get a cult that seems to keep bees and act like a colony of bees. The women seem to be dominant on the island while the men work and cannot speak.The plot is basically about a cop going onto the island looking for a lost girl that turns out to be his daughter it seems he as an allergy to bees and that must suck since the island is full of them.He soon starts to believe that they want to sacrifice her to The Wicker Man but really it's him since they believe that if he gets burnt the bees will produce honey again.Although it doesn't have a strong plot The Wicker Man does have some memorable moments such as the bees being poured all over Nicholas Cage's character.The Wicker Man remake is entertainingly bad and funny for all the wrong reasons the original version is obviously superior. Try the remake out but don't expect a lot. 5/10

If you saw the original you know how pathetic this is in comparison. But even if you didn't you would think this is putrid. I know nothing about film making yet I could do better than this. Some may say that it's not fair to compare a remake to an original but how can you not? Let's get the comparisons under way. The original had a soundtrack so memorable that I still think of it decades after hearing it. The religious juxtaposition of a devout Christian virgin opposite a bunch of island pagans made for dynamic drama. Also there was the song of the temptress and the May Pole dance etc. This version had none of that.But what really ruins this film is the inability to create an eerie atmosphere and the lack of urgency in Cage although I love him as a personality in other films. Shouting and cursing cannot convey alone the true shock and horror a person feels in a given situation. It requires good acting. Cage is a personality not an actor. This was the wrong role for him. You could feel the intensity and outrage of the lead actor in the original version. That's what made the film.Let's not forget the larger than life persona of Christopher Lee Lord Summerisle in the original. Ellen Burstyn looked like she was doing this while waiting for her laundry to dry. In the original you could see that Lord Summerisle and the locals loved their culture. Beyond the sacrifice aspect they just genuinely enjoyed being Celtic pagans. In this one they looked bored and cynical.But even without comparing the old and new this one falls flat and most of the fault lies with Cage's performance. Of course the whole movie hinges on the last scene. He was so awkward and struggling so hard to portray a sense of desperation but I wasn't buying it.Back to comparisons. The song of the swaying villagers while the Wicker Man burned in the original put the icing on the cake of that masterpiece. A bunch of weirdoes chanting that something must die didn't do if for me here.

column4: The Dangers of Matriarchy and any system similar
column5: With 4th wave feminism ( yup its existed since 2012 >;<) firmly in its own mess for a few years now is a perfect time to touch upon this cautionary tale about the dangers of one gender lording over the other. I know this is not a terribly popular film probably having a very small select fanbase  even if considered fondly alongside the original film but it was not terrible. There have been as most can surmise countless thousands of situations where when two people "tango" often a women does not reveal that she has become pregnant or even bother to tell her former partner that a child was born . Many nowadays would say " thats a womans right"  but that doesnt sound responsible sensible or right at all. Without a conversation all there is that occurs is one side basically having their way over the feelings and thoughts of another. And thats what we deal with in this film. We start with a cop whom though seemingly good hearted is pretty crappy at his job; pulling osmebody over in the beginning and walkking away while asking if they know why they were pulled over. Kinda half arsed at best. But then there is a mystery afoot regarding a former lover that desperately asks for help and to meet upon an isolated island far away. This is of course after a tragedy occurred and the male protagonist doesnt seem to have any family or real friends or happiness in his life so naturally he goes a runnin' to help his ex while on paid leave. HEs a "good" "guy" after all... Fast forward to a lengthy couple of stop overs and various vehicular switch offs that land our favorite crummy cop on an island where the women look like Cathy Bates from Misery. early 18th century Misery. ITs obvious something is off from the rustic living and garbs worn by all but the women are instantly recognized as being more present and seemingly in charge than the scant males seen. Now this is not necessarily a bad thing until more time passes and the investigation gets one hitch after another no doubt because of the truth needing to remain hidden but the womenfolk are not too keen on taking any orders or even having a conversation from a man. More and more its obvious that the men are wholly subservient from the youngest of ages as we eventually discover the islands inhabitants to be mimicking a bee colony. Most are like the drones and theres even a queen of sorts. But the women are always accorded almost all the rights over the males practically pushing them around as if it was pleasurable and maybe it was in the book but...theres reasons why this film gets such low ratings from so many. A hot chick here a familiar and sexy dame there. It may be nice to see ladies with so little makeup due to the films alleged adherence to a more naturalistic form of living but theres little to no joy in this film or from watching it most times. In the end we find out all the people on the island are descended from some celtic nutjobs from generations passed that like there ancestors believe in nature to the extent that it takes a stereotypical feminine association  like "mother gaia" or " nature goddess". But these are the same tools feminists claim men have been using to inflict our wills upon all with talk " god  the father" and similar historical "patriarchal" ideologies. But there is the kicker. INstead of creating a harmonious society where people can talk and live in such close knit community that there should almost instantly be peaceful coexistence  we have a hypocritical excuse for a matriarchal backwards society of women that ensnare menfolk from the outside world so as not to pollute their own with the curse of inbreeding. "You make Shnu shnu Mr Cages character?" No sir. I think not. This film quickly turns evermore upon Nick Cage's character until ultimately he discovers that he was but a pawn and then he is sacrificed within a giant wicker man as the pagan celtics used to do and germanic cultures. A few animals are thrown in the mix but ultimately this was all the film was about. LEarn aenough of the outside world then when a gal becomes old enough go out get knocked up come back ready to increase the populace and every now and then sacrifice ones former beau until it needs to all be done again. The silly thing is this only seems to have been needed on the rare occasions when crops failed and no salvation from motherf... mother gaia happen. However its assumed that after the final scene the womenfolk all just decide to do this regularly enough to always ensure a "fruitful" harvest. God this movie can be a headache. But something baout the fact that NIck Cage is in it leads me to give it at least an average rating of 5/10. I am as fond as a matriarchal society as a patriarchal one but if anyone reading this knows whats really happened since pre history congratulations you are one of the few that must also know that there were matriarchies long before supposed patriarchies until early men or whatever slightly evolved ape like things we were threw off the proverbial shackles. Still I cannot recall too many societies through history where a literal patriarchy existed in the form of a overbearing work the opposite gender to near death give absolutely no respect love attention consideration to or allow to speak. Hell the women in The Wicker Man cut off all the mens tongues from a young age. *smfh *. At least Cage kinda has a somewhat engrossing scene where his legs are broken before being sacrificed and he shouts " you b...tches" once or twice. Hilarious fitting and left me with a sneaking suspicion that the director might actually be a misogynist for this remake. As I said I dont like any society that has one side or gender just lording over the other regardless of what its called or whom runs it. So Have a drink and watch this for a quasi wild ride with an average show form our friend NIce Cage. WOKE! lol

column4: Story falls short of connecting plot points
column5: I agree with the IMDb critic but would add that the story's continuity was vague. Perhaps I missed something but the connection between Cage as an active police officer trying to save the girl in the car (and her mother) did not tie in to the letter he received. All we are told is that the victims of the car fire were unknown. We see flashbacks but none make much sense do not seem relevant to the story and primary plot? I ask myself why did they kill the airline pilot? He was the connection to the outside world for food and "stuff". You have to guess that all the men born had their tongues cut out.... but why? Loss of your tongue does not make you as weak and dumb as the meant seem in the movie.I have always enjoyed Cage's work until this..... his weakest performance but I agree the script and Director left him to wander from a depressed cop to an overly aggressive panic driven x-cop. (I assume x-cop as we do not have any information on his police status.The bee scene was unreal. Here is a guy who carries medicine for insect bites running madly through a bunch of bee hives. Didn't his doctors give him any information on behavior when exposed to millions of bees? Plus why would he knowingly walk into bee heaven? This film was a real downer!

column4: Far too negative of a review
column5: I watched and enjoyed the original avoiding the remake until recently due to the bad reviews on IMDb. I regret not watching this movie earlier it was superior to the original and Cage did a fine job.Both movies had extremely horrific endings and the humor was a way for the audience to swallow the bitterness of the end. I believe many in the American audience misunderstood the black comedy of this film and gave low ratings.The funniest part of the film was Cage being a motorcycle traffic cop and coming to the island as a detective. Seems most of the humor was based upon a knowledge of the original Wickerman.Well worth watching don't believe the negative reviews on here. Unless you consider Shrek 3 or Spiderman 3 to be cinema gems.

Nicholas Cage is good as always. And that's all there is to it. This is by far one of the worst movies of the decade... Let me explain: You'll be watching a movie with a few funny scenes (but there's nothing funny in what the movie is about) you won't know what it exactly is about things happen that make no sense Cage remembers stuff that changes every 5 minutes you'll curse the moment you bought the ticket and the end will make you angry at the least. Namely the whole point of the movie seems to be this: no matter how hard you try evil wins in the end. I felt like asking for a refund. Better yet damage payment for the torture.

Horrible writing terrible acting stupid and out of sync soundtrack! I'm really hoping that the original was better than this. Nicholas Cage one of my favorite actors was just pathetic. I probably can't blame him too much for the lame performance given the even more lame script he was given to work with! Don't waste your money on this or your TIME once it hits HBO/Max or whatever. The premise of this was good enough but the filming the unbelievability (is that a word?) of the characters and again the awful AWFUL writing just made this one of the worst movies I've seen. Maybe I'll check out the 9/11 movie Nicholas Cage is in... I'm sure he's much better in that!

This movie was absolutely amazing with a fantastic ending and outcome. It had a good story to it and delivered! For people who hated this movie I'm confused for because this was what I call a inspiring awesome weird horror . I've got to words for this movie it rock I would give this movie a 7.0 /10 If people were really horror fans they would enjoy and understand where the movie is coming from I've got to say that this movie has to be my 2nd favourite horror movie first be misbegotten another underrated movie. 7.0/10 overall it could of been a 10 if the movie went faster and not as slow as it did.

column4: Bad to Great Until the Bitter End
column5: OK while the top review did pretty much summarize my feelings about this movie I had a few problems with it; yes you could see the end coming about 20 miles off (about the distance of cell phone coverage in this movie apparently).I also love Nicholas Cage and it clearly looked as if he was tired of the film about halfway through. The script did something that I think no director likes to be forced to do which is to promise more than it delivers. You have a distinct feeling that something more is going on something else is happening à la The Ring etc but in the end he just plain dies. No twist no nothing. Up until this point there's been an undercurrent of whispery noises and just few enough references to this mysterious "Wicker Man" that you're interested enough not to walk out of the darn thing despite Mr. Cage's obvious ennui and the weird lighting (many of the night scenes' lighting setups were so yellow they looked just like daylight streaming in through the windows/leaves and the midnight forest was backlit as if by floodlights--all in the middle of an organic hippie commune).Also you find it hard to believe that these women could continue their plot year after year and get away with it no-one noticing the disappearance of any male who goes there or meets anyone from that place oh well... Cage's character did tell his friend he was thinking about going there and on his cell phone which worked twice in the movie--oddly enough miles away from the mainland shore--he yelled "help me!!" and cell phone usage location records are traceable by the police in a disappearance investigation.Anyway I could have put up with all of that if there had just been a bit more to deliver at the end. End of story.

When i saw the trailer for this movie i wanted to see it right away cause it looked pretty cool. But in the first 30 minutes of the movie i knew that this was a extremely low-level film. I literally had to concentrate myself to watch the rest of it. It was just getting more and more bad and stupid. The script was very poor and the acting sucked big time. The only reason that i've voted 2 instead of 1 is because Nicholas Cage is the only one that actually know how to act his performance wasn't that bad. Everyone else sucked! The plot was meant to be original "they" said but oh my god it was not! I've seen this kind of movies a houndred times! It's not that far from "Population 436" witch by the way also sucked! But still overall this movie is veryvery..VERY bad...!!! Don't waste your time watch something else.

column4: Stupid woman-hating and suspenseless...but I enjoyed it more than the original
column5: I didn't like the first "Wicker Man" for several reasons: (1) no mystery: the ending was predictable almost from the outset; (2) no ending: the last act should have resolved the religious conflict that lay at the heart of the story and it didn't it was essentially irrelevant; (3) no style: everyone all too clearly thought they were doing something good and serious but the film couldn't escape looking like a cheap horror movie of the period: a Tigon film with delusions of grandeur; (4) fake folk music: however much research went into it it sounded like an undergraduate project for music class. In this remake the music is standard suspense movie music and so it doesn't annoy; the talk is never serious and so it doesn't pretend; there is no religious conflict to resolve and so it doesn't distract; the ending isn't predictable (if you haven't seen the first movie) and so it doesn't hang fire; for all these reasons I enjoyed watching this movie most of the way through more than the first; until the pleasure faire at the end when it turns obviously silly it plays like "Harvest Home" or some other typical TV movie that holds the interest minimally; never more but never less. However this one is unusually stupid unusually misogynistic and--for a would-be suspense movie--unusually short on suspense. The ending is unforeseeable everything is unforeseeable because the characters' preceding behavior doesn't naturally lead up to it or to anything; it's illogical and ill motivated all the way through and so anything might happen at any time. But unlike the first movie this one didn't get my goat (or should I say put a bee in my bonnet?); and I liked two things about it--the photography of the island and the performance by the schoolteacher--which is more than I can say for some of the other thirty-year-old thrillers now undergoing cosmetic reconstruction (cf. "The Omen" and "The Amityville Horror").

Let's be frank people who grade this astonishingly bad film with more than one star must have used heroine or acid while they were watching it. I have never experienced such a mixture of disappointment and pure rage walking out of a movie theater. The first thing I did was order a triple whiskey at the nearest bar to get the weird and even painful feeling of having been mentally raped out of my system. The entire movie is filled with loose suggestive ends to make the thin transparent plot more bearable but all this does is create the hope that the movie is at some point going to get better or at least that there is something more behind the story other than that Nicholas Cage is going to be sacrificed (which if you HAVEN'T used acid or heroine you know is going to happen in under 15 minutes). Yet in the end nothing is explained (the female cop the accident the meed the twins the crow in the cupboard the bees the embryos the silent men the man with the bee stings the telephone call during the hilarious bear-escape scene) and what you feared becomes reality you have just watched the crappiest movie of the millennium and you were stupid enough not to walk away. To all who have not seen this movie yet I envy you! Cherish you're ignorance. To all who have seen this film and hated it I know how you feel! Warn others! And to all who have seen it and liked it how dare you lure the innocent to a movie like this! If you call this taste than Police Academy 15 must have been an all time classic to you! In short the worst movie ever on all fronts! Thank you Hollywood!

I thought that this movie was decent however i think that most of the changes made from the original were simply for the sake of change to justify the remake (i.e. honey instead of apples)Also the dream sequences/psychosis/hallucination thing seems a little ridiculous considering it is hardly explained and the only purpose it serves is to allow some creepy bee special effects to be added. I was expecting a little more light to be shed on the paranormal powers that existed which is where i thought the visions would be coming from but no it was just left a loose end. Also the old woman is clearly depicted as having some kind of power yet this is also left wide open.All in all i think they have tried to add an extra dimension to the film with the changes they have made however they did not follow through with it left a whole bunch of loose ends hanging resulting in what could have been some interesting depth coming across as superficial changes.

column4: What are you guys talking about? This movie is fine! (Satire)
column5: I have to admit this movie so bad that it's good. I wish I gave it a 10 but I have to keep it real though. I think this movie is a shot for shot remake but the difference is that it's a women colt I think. The script is lazy the writing is weak the story is poorly told and the acting is SOOOOOOOOO funny! Is it the worse remake of all time? No. Did they tried their best? Yes they did. This is my review on The Wicker Man (2006) one more thing. OH NO! NOT THE BEES! NOT THE BEES!!! AGHHHHHH!!! ALL OVER MY EYES!!! MY EYES!!! AGHHHH!!! AGHHHH!!! 1.7/10

column4: This movie is OK! ( This was a review written by me in a news paper in NorthEast Philadelphia)
column5: In the middle of the night and rain pouring outside....a movie called "The Wicker Man" was reviewed. This movie is full of bull **** when it says its scary or anything related. Yet this movie is weird. The Wicker Man starts out with a man he tries to save a girl from an accident but it blows up supposedly killing the little girl and mother. After 6 months or so Hes taking drugs and seems very depressed. Then he gets a letter from this woman saying her daughter is missing and that shes his run away engagement. He goes to find this girl which is on a private island. Once there the movie begins. But it sucks. There are too many scenes where he is running around too less scenes of something scary or that would progress the story. And in watching this movie the characters kept changing the story around about the where abouts of this little girl and i could tell the man was very annoyed and confused too. This movie doesn't bring anything to the table accept screaming at the end. The only problem with this movie was it was too funny. It had stupid scenes where this guy would see someone that had been torn in half eyes missing and mouth tied shut and he still shakes him to see if hes alive.It had good photography and thats what I will say is only good. I also think this movie is too crazy to even take seriously because if someone runs away from somewhere gets engaged and loves being out of the place she once was who in the hell will believe she would go back. Its a good date movie with laughs and occasional jumps and scares yet it just isn't that good of a movie for those die-hard horror moviegoers.The only thing i can say about the guy in this movie and his stupidity shame on you! I give this movie 2 out of 4 stars.

I enjoyed this movie very much. I don't know what people found humorous about it though.It had a consistent flow complex plot and fascinating concept. Not to mention the twist was executed splendidly.Not a horror whatsoever more of a mystery. Also the situation of which complicated the main character's direction towards his overall goal made things really interesting.To enjoy any movie you can't just assume be prejudice or take anyone else's opinions and not except it if it doesn't live up to your expectations. If you haven't seen or read a story you need to pay attention and find everything else out for yourself. Keep an open mind.

FirstlyI know this is a remakeand I'm pretty clear of the fact that usually a remake cannot match its original counterpartparticularly this filmwhose original version got a high score while the remake got mere 3.5surprisingly.I haven't watched the original myselfso what I can do is just make comments on this oneand to be frankit's surely underrated here.In terms of the visual languagesits downside happens to be its upside.Known as a thrillerthis film is neither shot in dark lighting nor filled with particularly horrified scores/soundsneverthelessthe whole atmosphere is oddunnatural and rather enigmaticeven if for most of the screen timeit is daylight that occupies.Also I wanna give credit to the props&make-up crews for the masks and costumes appearing in this film are impressivemaking those odd residents appear more freakish.The acting of Cage is fine but not particularly outstanding.Compared with Cageother people's acting is forgettable.What interests me the mosthoweveris the theme of this film.The ending(which is another highlight of this film due to its unconventionality)reveals that the whole 'issue' is totally a set-up and the only victim is Edward himself.But the interesting thing ishe is chosen not only because he has a blood bond with one of the local resident(Willow) which according to the sisterscould guarantee a better harvestbut also his male identityas the Summer Isle is actually a female society and "drones must die".Note how Rose teaches her students that the ultimate representation of male is phalluswhich indicates that men are only used for breeding.Thereforethe death of Edward is inevitable.The especially evil thing about this film is that it alarms people how far humans can go with the total blindness of their belief-it is where murder is not murderbut part of legitimate ritual;it is where civilization is totally lost and kids turn out to be demons.Or maybethe trick of this film isif we stand asidecharging their belief as insanewe will be dismissed as "patronizing"as self-acclaimed cultured people? Thinking about all those old religions(e.g.voodooshamanism)existing todayhow is it possible that cannibalism for one society could be 'normal' custom for another?

I found The Wicker Man hilarious and laughed through a good part of it although I don't think it was supposed to be a comedy. Parts were so ridiculous that I could help but burst out into laughter.I gave it a 5 because as silly as it was it kept me interested and amused so I wanted to know what happened at the end. If it hadn't kept my interest that long it would have probably deserved a 3.Parts were creepy but then something else would happen and I'd laugh again. Willow was an absolute horrible character. Although I never saw the original I can only imagine what that would have been like. This was the most ridiculous crazy movie...although entertaining because I laughed a lot!

So I watched the original "The Wicker Man" the night before in preparation for the Cage version. And in watching the new one I am left with the impression that the filmmakers wanted to make a parody but parodies of 30+ year old movies having as they do rather limited audiences they masqueraded it as a remake to get it produced.The end result is somewhere in between a parody and a remake and it's pretty weird. The audience for this film is probably even tinier -- those expecting a remake will be disappointed by a slew weird changes from the original film and those who haven't seen the original will probably find it to be an incoherent mess. But with the original fresh in mind and having no especial fondness for it I found the remake highly entertaining. And as a vehicle for Cage to do what he does best that is go a little bit crazy this film is ideal.Take for example a scene early in the film where Cage visits a school classroom. The scene is ripped directly from the original film but exaggerated and made funny. "Phallic symbol phallic symbol" chant the children as if quoting the original film and stripping it of context and meaning. Then there's the crow in the desk. And then there's Cage's dramatic point at the empty desk. All of these moments are funny if you remember the original. The teacher's slip of the tongue in this scene is particularly funny because you realize that she's just revealed something the film wasn't supposed to reveal yet -- but the dramatic tension isn't lost because having seen the original you already knew what was going to happen.From there it gets worse if you've not seen the original. The whole pagan thing is never actually explained and instead there's this weird women vs. men thing going on. On reflection I have no idea what the point of the beginning was. Other important details that made the narrative of the original cohesive are brushed over. And there's an added twist to the original twist ending that obviously doesn't make sense. Good film.

column4: Not a B movie a Z movie!!
column5: The movie was awfully awful!!! I can't believe that Nickolas agreed to play in this movie!!! The only thing i can think of is that he is broke and he needed money. Big waste of time. Not a B movie a Z movie!! Why do i have to write 10 lines? i don't have nothing more to say about the movie. I am sorry if i have spelling mistakes but English is not my mother language. This is the best i can do. Can i write in Greek? Anyway i think i have 10 lines now. Thanks for your time. My text was sh-rinked in seven lines. So i think i have to write more... OK What else? The budget for the movie was too low. They tried to do something like the "blair witch project". To make money out of nothing with no cost. It happened once and thats it it won't happen again. Is the text enough to be posted?

This isn't nearly as bad as reviewers say. I see far worse movies get far better reviews and ratings here.I've seen the original film a few times since it was released. This one was inferior fwiw but not egregiously so. Sure creative decisions led to some of the acting being needlessly vague and frustrating more than disturbing or suspenseful. The bees motif could have been chosen or used better. The writing was looser than it should have been. Cage who CAN act seemed to be taking no risks here but he didn't have much script to work with and who knows what kind of direction he was getting.As for the accusations that this is unintentionally hilarious -- I know what they're referring to but I don't see it other than the bear scene. I chalk it up to mob mentality of "we hate Cage."

Nicholas Cage is one of the greatest actors of this generation. Cage seems to be the only one who understands that this film can work on different levels and he knows just when to play it for laughs when to play it for that action/adventure schtick and when to play it for straight up horror. Brilliant. Kate Beahan also delivers a very solid performance as Cage's estranged girl. This movie must be taken with a grain of salt and suffice it to say this is not a movie everyone will enjoy but if you walk into the theater in the right frame of mind you can definitely find some enjoyable moments here (not the least of which Nicholas Cage hitting a woman- I'm not sexist but how far over PC can you go? plus it was a very irritating character that he hit; in our theater when Cage punched the woman it got a round of applause. How cool is that?).

column4: Nicolas Cage in a bear suit. This movie stinks!
column5: I have Pagan friends who despise this film with a savage intensity. Given its mean-spirited portrayal of them I can certainly understand why. As if that weren't bad enough the film has numerous plot points that were either abandoned or simply didn't make sense:In an early scene Office Edward Malus (Nicolas Cage) pulls over a car occupied by a mother and her young daughter. Out of nowhere an 18-wheeler barrels into the car setting it ablaze. As Malus attempts to rescue them the mother and daughter seemingly vanish into thin air. First why was the truck on the wrong side of the road much less in the breakdown lane? Second just who were that mother and daughter? And for that matter why was their car unregistered?How did Willow's letter get to Malus without a stamp?If outsiders aren't allowed on Summersisle why does it have an inn?At the inn Malus mentions that the cassette tapes he brought with him had disappeared from his luggage. The tapes are never mentioned again.What's the deal with the bird trapped in the old school desk?Why don't the men on the island speak? Are they unable to? It's never explained.While Malus is searching an underwater crypt for the missing child somebody closes and locks the lid to the opening through which he entered it. Why do that and risk his drowning when they need him alive for their ritual?After spending all night underwater (except for his head) Malus immediately bounces back and continues his search for the missing child. Naturally his clothes are bone-dry not two minutes later.Why was that little girl hiding in the closet?You inject an Epi-Pen into the outer thigh not the damned neck!Lastly my DVD copy (which I found in a $2.00 bin) features what it calls a "shocking alternate ending not seen in theaters." All it does is leave out the epilogue. This version ends with the chants of "The drone must die." So not only was the theatrical release garbage the DVD was a scam!

This is the American remake of the 1970s British version. It's a good copy with obvious changes here & there - ie: place names. It's a folk custom/folk lore/folk tale thing that dishonours an unwelcome guest or intruder to a suburban village.You'll find that many English customs and rituals are very much like 'The Wicker Man' and very much a community thing with the expectation that all 'will want to'' attend or participate. 'Jack in the Green' also known as 'Jack o' the Green is one such practice that continues today.

I have never seen the original and therefore I cannot compare the two. However after only five minutes into this film I knew it was a bomb. I watched the entire thing hoping that it would improve. It didn't. Every time I would get remotely interested in a character they would no longer be developed or would do exactly what I expected of them. Also to me there seemed to be so many props that were just there for show and had nothing at all to do with plot development. In addition to this the musical score was annoying. I believe that a suspense film cannot be made or ruined by it's musical score but it can be made better or worse by it's score. This one was certainly made worse. Sadly there is nothing good at all I can say about this film. I have no idea how someone of Ellen Burstyn's caliber became involved in this project. Pathetic.
Best movie. I thought it was good just becausenof nicolas cages acting

I disagree with the negative reviews this film is getting. I saw the remake today and I've seen the British classic cult film a couple of times which I admired especially Woodward's and Lee's performances. I do agree that the transition to the American setting was a bit clumsy -- the whole commune idea is a bit out of date for 2005-2006 (whereas in 1973 it was very current) and the weird matriarchy/beehive/feminist premise in the remake may have been credible in the 1970s 1980s or mid 1990s but not now. I wondered if there was a critique of Mormonism in this film however and noticed by looking up the director Neil LaBute on the IMD/Wiki that he has split from that church.At any rate they changed the whole 'fertility premise' for the commune between the two movies in order to accommodate the change in values over time -- and the difference in values between Britain and America. Where the 1973 film was licentious this one was weirdly wholesome. Where once free love (the basis of the commune in the 1973 film) was shocking now the removal of men from the process of responsible procreation is the real question in the remake. I did not find that part believable. Modern masculinity may be going through a crisis because of feminism and modern life but it isn't going to become redundant.The film is well shot and the colours -- I've rarely seen so many levels of pink green and gold in one movie with the colours still being innocuous -- are just beautiful. Very very dreamlike and I noticed that the colours get more monochromatic in gold as the end approaches. It is far more polished in terms of lighting and cinematography than the 1973 film. But the key to the film's success -- which I think will become apparent to viewers over time is the innovative treatment of human relationships in the story by the director Neil LaBute. In the first version the policeman is anonymous to the island he is merely driven by his commitment to his job upholding the law and his private religious faith and his own virginity. He dies not just because he goes to the island but also because he refuses the temptation of the barmaid and remains a sexual innocent. If he had only had sex with her he would have saved himself! That is a pretty typical example of British irony. I think such irony would have been more than lost on American audiences and would have been counter-intuitive when displayed in an American context.In a way the remake is far more interesting in terms of casting Cage as the father of the missing little girl. He has a personal stake in what happens that is far more profound -- and the fact that he returns to find the girl's mother Willow shows that he is already a marked man because he can't get over his past. He is doomed because he cannot get over that one relationship with someone who has already treated him unforgivably. The fact that he obviously hopes to save the girl and leave with Willow (who is clearly a bad deal all the way through) and have a second chance at having a real family shows how profoundly low his self esteem is. That IS interesting. The question at the heart of this film really is: what's more important? Standing up for yourself and living a boring mundane yet safe life (presumably with his fidgety policewoman partner)? -- Or going like a moth to the flame with the slimmest of hopes of re-finding and saving your doomed lost dreams with the slightest of chances that they just may come to life and it all may work out in your favour? Cage's character picks the latter option and that error in judgement proves his undoing. Underneath the story the film is really remarking sadly about what is done to and thought about the real dreamers in our society: they are weak and deserve to die. I think that's a message that we should all pause and reconsider.

The Wicker Man (2006) is another example of the absurd unimaginative creativeness in the brains of producers and directors in modern day Hollywood as it is a nearly word for word remake of a film that was admittedly also not very good but still not nearly as bad as this one turned out to be.This remake has several scenes that are literally an exact copy from the original The Wicker Man (1973) with the only notable differences being that the Island is now a feminist utopia in which men are made mute and serve merely as brainless servants of the 'mighty female supremacy' that seems to rule in this idiotic world. It is ofcourse an absurd ideology and an absurd situation to which you will never be able to relate. The naked women from the original have also been removed so the only real differences between the original and the remake seem to be based on ridiculous politically correct subjects so the modern snowflake community can't get offended by it's 'sexism' as they would call it these days.A word for word remake in which only the political correctness has been added to is ofcourse utterly pointless and it is no different in this case. The original was already severely lacking in its script or its depth but the remake manages to be even worse. Nicolas Cage is a pretty mediocre actor but there is not really any doubt that this is by far his worst performance ever seen on film. Even by Cage standards his overacting is absolutely ridiculous. He is constantly seen yelling like a madman in loads of scenes ( Not the beeeeess! How'd it get burned?!?!?!? ) his anger towards the latter stages seem to be initiated because the script tells him to and not really because Cage embodies his character well in any way. Even early on Cage Always seems to interrupt people with the most awkward and cringy of dialogue choices ( His thought of a shark being in a couple of the villagers bag ) or in the case of his interruption in the school class weird awkward laughing at little girls who discuss a 'phallic symbol'. Ofcourse in the original this is discussed in detail in a sentence after that but in the remake this is ofcourse removed due to political correctness.It is a mystery on paper but its mystery is solely there because characters are constantly beating around the bush when talking to Cage even his runaway girlfriend Willow Woodward who is played by Kate Beahan who constantly seems to be confused and unable to understand the lines that she is spouting out which is ofcourse not very surprising with such a terrible near word for word copy of an already mediocre script. Cage never seems to realize anything his character has to be the dumbest detective that has ever been created for film. He is constantly easily tricked by all the women on the Island he follows a little girl instead of leading her himself he lets someone empty his gun without him knowing he dives into some water entered via a kind of grate which can easily be blocked ( Which ofcourse happens ) and many more ridiculous actions.The cinematography does not have an eye or a feel for the situation of the characters in the film and also does not try to improve immersion in any way with visual symbolisms or the sort. It also has night scenes in woods for example that are lit up like a thousand light bulbs where it could have been a great opportunity for some minimal lighting to catch the dark tone of the movie. However these kind of intellectual additions are non existent in this already unoriginal and bland remake.The final stages of the film consists of Cage beating up a couple of women ( I was very surprised they were allowed to film that on account of the idiotic feminist message this film makes ) including one in a bear suit which has to be one of the greatest unintentionally funny moments ever seen on film. The women are admittedly annoying in The Wicker Man but since Cage's character is a complete idiot that comes up with the most immature and inhumane responses possible it isn't possible to relate with him either but since his acting is also so ridiculously bad it atleast becomes quite funny to witness Cage's most embarrassing performance.In the end the entire world displayed here is one great ridiculous feminist fantasy a world that is solely based on ideals that should never be put into film in such a disgusting manner as this kind of world only exists as a propaganda form. Combined with absolutely horrendous acting ( Especially Cage & his runaway girlfriend ) & terrible script this is a ridiculous affront to the world of cinema in general.

This movie it's far from being a horror but it's a funny way in which the Pagan ways are depicted and all I can say is that it brought me a great mood and revived my Pagan pride. Leelee Sobieski is beautiful. I don't see why wouldn't this movie be enjoyable for non-Pagans too (Christians for example) as it's very original one of the best movies Nicholas Cage might have brought himself into.Honestly this is not a 10 star movie but I can't give it less then 7.5 perhaps the extra 0.5 (which rounds it to 8) would be my personal weakness for Leelee Sobieski so take it at somewhere between 7 - 8. You won't waste your time nor money at the Cinema I didn't it brought me an outstanding mood mostly Leelee Sobieski's smile at the end of the movie terrific!!! See it by yourself.

Unfortunately the film features the actor Nicholas Cage rather more than the story. Generally speaking Cage is a good actor however the story ought to be the principal draw with the actors fleshing out characters and making the screenplay believable. And because the original was so effective the remake begins with the handicap of having to live-up to an original story and genuinely thoughtful horror story. The original has a quality of complexity not evident in this version. It also seems rather odd to develop a film with the same conclusion - but for some reason reversing the order of sexual procreative domination (from the original)while pretty much emasculating males beyond their value as a tool for impregnating the women. The saving grace was the beautiful British Columbia scenery.

A lot of people have been ragging on this film. I kind of see why. The original is a well liked film and the remake in no way reaches its heights of bizarreness. Had there never been an original film then maybe this one wouldn't be so looked down upon. The story is sound as cop Edward Malus travels to Summerisle to search for a missing girl. This is the same basic gist of the original but the remake does toss in a few new touches here and there. Before there was a Lord Summerisle but now the island is a matriarchal society. The singing and dancing have been pretty much removed from the proceedings so don't expect a nude Britt Eklund doing a fertility dance. Also new is the cop's connection to the proceedings. Its nice too that the downbeat ending was left in tact as well. While it falls short of the original it could have turned out far worse. It could have been done as a comedy.
I don't understand how movies this bad r able to b made. It's truly horrible as a whole

I was so disappointed in this movie. I knew that it was a remake of a b-movie from the 70's but had no idea that it would fall so flat. It was so completely non-believable from the start. There were too many times that I thought "There is no way a policeman would do that". People left the theater. I should have left. For a while I thought that maybe Ellen Byrsten's appearance would lift it up. No she just fell flat on her face too. I can't believe James Franco agreed to do this movie. Albeit it was a small part but his name is still attached to a stink movie. Nick Cage Ellen Byrsten Leelee Sobieski... should have made a great movie.

Just plain rubbish. Wait for it to come on TV and then watch the adverts instead.I didn't want to say anything more than that really but IMDb rules state that you're not allowed to post a comment that has less than ten lines of text.Thinking of being clever I thought of cutting and pasting the word 'Rubbish' 200 times but there are rules against that too.Have I completed ten lines yet? I do hope so because I really don't have anything positive to say about this film. No just short of ten lines still.Okay this movie was really really rubbish. I only hope it wont put people off seeing the original.There I did it.

column4: I must be seeing something most don't....
column5: I completely do not understand why this movie is universally panned by literally everyone and every website. I liked this movie! I just seen this randomly with some friends I thought it was going to be scarier but I ended up loving the weird and creepy tones it reminded me of that used-to-be show on Disney Channel where that girl would go around to different towns and inspect weird supernatural things that show that was way too creepy for modern Disney standards. And this movie has the exact same feel although it's definitely more adult. It keeps you on edge and it also freaks you out a bit.I mean good things about it: Nicholas Cage good imagery stuff that's to weird to get weird twists and turns and a decent ending. I honestly can't find a 'bad' thing about it other than the fact it's not my favorite movie. Everyone's saying the acting was lame I loved the characters! I think the acting was perfect for what the film was trying to portray. It's a weird movie geez. It's not supposed to be Batman. One of the best movies Cage has been in and I think this is the type of film he likes to be in. I'd say see it! And it's not like this is the first weird movie I've seen I'm a huge fan of the weird horror supernatural and whatever else and I've seen way worse. The Unborn comes to mind there. And I'd watch Wicker Man even a second time! I say it's pretty good!(With all this in mind though I have not seen the original.)

column4: Hollywood terrorists destroy British cult film
column5: Thanks a lot Hollywood not only have you made the worst remake of any film ever but you have completely destroyed a piece of British Film History. You have taken a cult classic and urinated all over it. Might have been a good idea to make cage watch the original before letting him take a huge turd on the camera. Also whoever decided to cast cage as the wicker man needs a kicking i can think of over a billion people that could have done a better job including my deceased gran. If you needed proof that Hollywood has gone to the dogs well here it is. People with brains watch the original and ignore this guff! Doesn't even deserve 1 out of 10! Extra Stilton and no frills - 0/10

Uncessary remake of the cult film of the same name.It isn't that bad I've seen worse.What i couldn't get my head around was that they changed the story in some wayssuch as the island in this version is dominated by women and men have little purpose there{or do they}. Nicolas Cage is called to the island under false pretences by a former girlfriendwho claims that her daughter has gone missing and she later tells him that he is the paternal father. He quickly travels to the island to help her and finds that the locals are not very interested in the girls whereabouts and they also practise some very strange customs. In the original version Edward Woodward{the policeman}is a virgin and that is why he was chosen for sacrificein this remake Nicolas Cage is obviously not a virgin as hes fathered a childSo why was this part of the story changed. And because these parts of the story were changed i was expecting an alternative ending and was disappointed that there wasn't one.In my opinion an alternative ending would have been the only thing that would have saved the film considering how many other things were changed.But for some reason at the end they decided to stay loyal to the originalonly making it more horrific by breaking Nicolas Cages legs when hoisting him up into the not to inviting Wicker Man figure. The good points about this film is that the location is beautiful and the atmosphere is genuinely eeriethe acting isn't bad although i feel that Nicolas Cage is badly miscast here he just doesn't look comfortable in this role which is another reason this film doesn't seem to work.

I almost didn't rent this movie because of all of the horrible reviews but I am glad I did see it. After I saw it I bought the movie and have watched it many times. The soundtrack which I also bought is creative and suspenseful. The script isn't that great but the directing makes up for it. Nicolas Cage and Ellen Burstyn did great acting in this movie. I really don't understand why many people make fun of this movie. It's about time someone made a good horror/mystery that's not about blood and guts.Please don't judge this movie from its reviews! I beg you to watch it and decide for yourself!

column4: One of the greatest/worst movies ever made
column5: I love this movie. Yes it is a bad movie. But man is it an entertaining one. And Nicolas Cage man... That dude is a legend. This movie makes little to no sense but i don't care. I don't know if this movie was supposed to be an intentional comedy or an uninterntinal comedy but either way I had a great time with it. So yeah enter at your own risk I guess. But for me the risk definitely paid off. Will be watching this one again for sure. A good time is a good time. I mean you can't go wrong with Nicolas Cage in a bear suit running towards a woman and punching her in the face.

column4: The worst movie of all times
column5: I have never written a movie review in my life before but I just had to write one for this movie. I figured I'd save people their hard earned money.To actually properly convey how horrible this movie is I will use a simple comparison. I want you to think of the worst movie you've ever seen. Now imagine that compared to this the movie you've picked is The Godfather compared to The Wicker Man.This movie is absolutely appalling and I cannot believe Nicholas Cage is actually starring in it. This movie is not even worthy of the label "B-Movie".I'd personally be very surprised if this movie gets an average vote higher than a 1. I don't care how far "out there" anyone is no-one would give this movie a vote higher than a 1.Don't watch this movie not even if it's free... unless they pay for it and insist on being paid upfront.

column4: Why oh Why Did Hollywood Bother To Remake ?
column5: I put down my $9 at the kiosk and sauntered off to the designated screen for what I had hoped was a fantastic remake of a true classic. But saddened I was to see that yet again Hollywood had failed to produce a remake worthy of the former film's name.Questions1. Why did I fall for this ruse? 2. Why did I waste 3 hours of my life? 3. Why did I waste $9 (as well as the price of popcorn and gas) ?I'm not sure i can offer anything good to say about this film. The acting was stale predictable and glassy especially Nick Cage who in my opinion has yet to deliver a role worthy of his profession. The cinematography was poor and the screenplay was broken.The original 1973 version continues to be exciting memorable and has aged very well indeed. Cut to the chase get a copy of this from your local store (or Netflix) and make your own popcorn for a home viewing.

column4: Yeat another Nicolas Cage movie destroyed by wrong genre pick by production
column5: This was for sure a surrealistic comedy not a serious horror film. If you don't see that you are a dummy. It was so funny and surprising! Laughed out loud loved the casting and the locations. Nick Cage's character goes more and more insane and I loved it all.

clever it may drag on but movies have to have a good story which this has. people who say its rubbish are talking nonsense the whole movie was good apart from a few minor things. Nicholas Cage is really good at acting in this film deffinatley one of his best moments. This film is disturbing and if. The film sticks to the original story but it has been tweaked a bit. The film is mentally scary to think of people like devil worshippers make this film the extra bit better. The film has cut out some of things to make this film a 12 loads more people can now enjoy an excellent remake of a still great movie. you liked the original you will like this. If you don't like it just because its not scary thats a bit childish. overall great!

column4: A pallid remake of the original
column5: This is a terrible remake of what is still a rather eerie little movie. For some strange reason it's been rewritten to take place in the Pacific Northwest where the original nod to pagan deities makes no sense at all. You can understand why the Cage character is bumbling around trying to find out what's happened to the missing child but why she's missing or what's going on doesn't make any sense at all even at the end. Not to mention--what's up with the bees motif anyway? Rather than being a mystery it's just a muddle.The acting isn't bad it's the script that awful. I feel sorry for these perfectly good actors who are trying to make this really dreadful material work. Was half of this movie left on the cutting room floor? I really wish this one hadn't been rewritten into this sad remake.

column4: Yeah way to ruin a movie.
column5: Enjoyed this movie literally up until the point where they actually kill Nicolas Cage... It may be a remake but c'mon kill the psychos!

column4: Flawed and lacking pace but definitely worth a watch
column5: I'm fed up of reading comments from people that start 'i left this movie half way through.' If that's true then you didn't watch the movie properly and your opinion is pretty much useless.Going to see this film as a huge fan of the original I found it in turn original disappointing frustrating clever and sweetly respectful of its source material. Quite a mixed collection of feelings.There were enough deviations from the original to make it a valid film in its own right so I'll completely avoid the ultimately pointless 'why do Hollywood keep doing remakes' argument. There is nothing new under the sun. However what was a little disappointing:1) as a film that could make the most of unsettling its audience by focusing on bizarre and unusual pagan rituals and beliefs it relied too much on bog-standard 'Cage is trapped underwater' 'Cage is falling through loose flooring' action/jump scenes. 2) all elements of the belief/faith and the erotic and therefore the crucial links between sex temptation testing and purity are overshadowed by a fairly shallow feminist pretence. Sex and sexiness are replaced by the red herring of sexual politics. Duff move especially with such beautiful leading ladies. 3) The wonderful folk soundtrack of the original (which added to its creepy earthiness and ancient tradition) has been replaced by a fairly lacklustre orchestral score with oddly pointless whispering. While I didn't expect the same songs here was potential for something far more daring. 4) Nobody man or woman was ever going to do a better job of the Lord Summerisle/Lady Summersisle role than Christopher Lee.Things that were good about it? Well it may be a remake but it's not a plot that's been done often so there's still a sense of surprise fear and originality to it. I would certainly class it as a thriller rather than a horror so i guess the lack of tension is slightly disappointing. However there's loads of recreated shots and subtle in-jokes that will tickle fans of the original. Even more satisfying in some ways are the references to Nic Roeg's 'Don't Look Now' (the original Wicker Man played as the B-Movie to 'DLN' in the UK.) So cue blind old ladies(with implied psychic powers) red coats lost little girls running in the shadows etc.Ultimately enough has been changed to make this film worth watching in its own right. The script is patchy but Cage is not half as bad as some say - in fact at points he is excellent). It honours the original's startling climax (although dumbs it down rather by setting up for a sequel) and while it won't ever be regarded as a classic it will hopefully enable a new generation to discover the horror and comedy and beauty of the true original.

There's nothing wrong with a suspense\mystery thriller. This had all the ingredients of a great movie. Chaotic opener lingering questions pagan background creepy island and a creature the audience would have loved before but now hates; i'll still drink the honey.Cage does his best to lead the cast but where he's leading them and why his motives are so strong are never really revealed. He doesn't even learn the girls true connection to him until he's already deeper than anyone should have gone given all he had to go by. It just isn't believable that a bike cop from a small canyon town is suddenly just going to go off and chase after a young girl he in his first thoughts had no connection to.The movie plays out well enough with a few well placed "personal worst fear" moments coupled with those "I can't believe he's doing "x" at "y" " instances (swimming in a crypt at night? digging up a grave alone? going to and staying on that island alone?). Cage's character plays the rational and logical person smacking a bit of mainlander common sense into the crazed society all the while displaying his contempt and apathy for their ways. He seemed to smart to be so dumb.The ending is well shocking to say the most. It reminds me of why all good hero's need to leave the fire-arm's at home and start carrying a sword. Sword's don't need aiming reloading or anything but a strong will.Pagan societies will be pagan societies. Despite the movie The Wicker Man itself was quite impressive.A bitter-sweet taste of corrupted honey for an end.

I disliked the movie a lot it looked very very unrealistic. If they carefully plan for him to go to the village he was not going to go to the school go to the grave and down a whole. And even more unrealistic when he was at the dock he saw the girl drowned then he goes for her when he woke up he had the girl then he woke up again. The end was horrible. I was guessing someone was going to save him or something I ended hating the movie. I even asked for my $10.50 back but i did not get my money back. At the time the movie ended I was very disappointed for spending my money on this movie. I would have expected a better plot of this movie. Everything was very very unrealistic the guy is just a police not an investigator. At the end it was very very fake when Nicolas wore the bear suit. The scene before that he beated up too women who were not ready for the festivity they were not dressed up nor did they have their costumes. It looked like he changed very fast and ran to the festivity and there was the two ladies at the front row sister Beach and sister and sister Honey with their costumes on and their make up on. It looked very very fake

column4: A pitiful script and uninspired directing
column5: Few movies are worthy of true scorn and the ones that merit praise have other posts that cover their successes.This movie merits scorn. Heaps of it.There isn't much need to give away the plot. There isn't much to give away this movie could have been 45 minutes shorter and it still would have dragged. Suffice to say Neil LaBute has no idea how to direct a suspense or horror movie. Much less how to write either genre. Cage tries to do his part but he is given nothing to work with. As for the ending it's so execrable it beggars description.If you want to see a horror film with a pagan/naturalistic bent rent "Lair of the White Worm".

column4: Not the original but not bad.
column5: I agree that this leaves gaps the original doesn't and in general does a poor job with the characters. However I really don't understand how anyone can give this a 1/10. There are worse movies out there plenty of them.While the basic story is the same as the original there are significant differences. This remake tries to go for a darker feel which is entertaining but doesn't work as well as it could. The acting character development and method by which the story is retold is sub-par.The movie is entertaining and worthwhile to see if you aren't someone biased against remakes on principle. It's possible this is scarier than the original (although neither is truly scary) but the original is a superior movie as a whole.

Nicky cage really ought to stop trying to be natural in his movies it is simply not working for him. This movie made no sense is awkward is so stupid and over the top it's laughable. At one point it wants to be some creepy strange cult movie at one a try of depression at another yet again a failed romance. It is all gloriously capped off with a group of none actors and over actors confusingly wondering about unsure what this film even is. They must have been seeking a paycheck cause they don't care and this movie doesn't seem to want to give them something. It's a hot mess but not one without its ironic comedic gold.

Come on now people it is not that bad! Yes the acting is a bit over the top yes key elements have been taken out but 1 star out of ten! I have just seen this film and i have to say as a standard thriller it was pretty good. Director neil la bute made a very striking opening and only let the film down right at the end Sequel anyone?! At least he had the ball's to kill off the a list star at the end the remake of get carter?. My advise is to drop all expectations at the door and give it a fair shot you may be surprised.RegardsPaul Gynn.

column4: Kinda nice to see a Nic Cage movie I missed before
column5: I find it hilarious how everyone is having exactly the same opinion and giving the same rating with one star.How bad must something be to give it 1 star? It like going to a restaurant and giving it one star because at least you got some food? Come on! Because of this attitude I just had to register at imbd and give it 10/10. Even if it's just annoying other.It's a classic Nicolas Cage movie in which people but an effort in. It might not be the best but in comparison what movies get produced nowadays it's still better than a lot of them. And the fact Nicholas Cage is starting in it makes it alone watchable enough.

OK so I gave this a 5 only because the movie...like beginning and middle was actually pretty good. It was suspenseful and it definitely sucks you in...however...the ending it ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE!! This middle was good to an extent...I mean he goes THE WHOLE MOVIE just looking for his daughter...none the less the guys that I was with and a lot of other people in the theater found a lot of the jumpy parts (to me) scary. Anyways...to sum it up...Don't waste your $7.25. Spend it on ice cream or another movie that is worth watching. I looked at these comments before I went to see the movie and thought it was just a couple of peoples opinions but seriously guys this movie really sucks! There's no point and the ending makes you so mad! Don't WASTE YOUR GOOD TIME! lol.

I went to see this with a friend while I was home on summer vacation. I have never seen the original. My friend and I settle down with our popcorn and we're expecting a thriller maybe a few scares just something at least a little spooky. We ended up laughing out-loud a few times instead and I hardly ever laugh even at comedies. When the car with the girl in it was hit by a truck the first time it wasn't scary it was very final destination so it was kind of expected. Anyway throughout the movie he keeps hallucinating and seeing the truck come out of nowhere and hit the car or a little girl. The 2nd time when the truck showed up out of nowhere on the ferry and t-boned a random 12 year old my friend and I were in hysterics. Even if i completely ignored the truck thing the rest of the movie was just....it wasn't anything! It wasn't scary or funny or even dramatic. He's chasing around looking for this little girl and a lot of the acting seemed off. Another thing was nothing there was so much in the movie that had nothing to do with anything. It was random and probably put in cause "it looked perty on film". Seriously don't waste your money. Oh and the ending was terrible too. They kept explaining to Nicolas Cage's character over and over and over. It redundantly redundant if you see my point.

I'm not quite sure how such film-makers get to this level in their careers I guess Neil LaBute has just been winging it up to this point because it seems no one was expecting this sh*t storm of a film. Anyway at least something positive has come from this catastrophe: a world wide joke for us all to enjoy laughing our asses off at a man in a bear costume punching a woman in the face oh and lets not forget my new favourite catchphrase "The bees are in my eyes!" If you have time to kill and an appreciation irony (as unintentional as it is in this film) watch this film it is truly magnificent; the bees and the bear costume the terrible acting and the comedy violence beautiful in every way. I will enjoy this film for a long time to come.

column4: A funny take on alternate society!
column5: This movie is immediately going on my top 5 movies of all time list. I can see how people who are expecting a horror don't like it. Expecting this to be a horror however is like expecting "Get Shorty" to be a mafia drama. This movie had me laughing out loud more than any comedy I've seen this year. What this movie does is takes a man and shows how he reacts to a completely different society than he was raised in. The behavior he displays to the locals can only be described has hilarious. Make no mistake about it though THIS IS NO HORROR MOVIE! If your looking to see a good horror flick don't waste your time go see the Grude 2 or something. That said this is the summers sleeper hit folks now get out there and see it!!

I can't believe that Nicolas Cage became a joke icon after this movie. This movie really sucks. I never saw the original one but I guess it is not better than this one...Nicolas Cage acts horrible in this movie. I never seen that kind of disaster like this. Other actor performed just like N. Cage. Plot was boring and won't like it.The last 3 minutes was a little bit interesting but it's not the whole movie. I almost slept in the middle of this movie. Thank god that I watched DVD because I will waste my money.I give a 3 for this hopeless movie...

column4: I want those two hours of my life back
column5: This movie is a POS. Even the acting sucks and that's saying something for Nick Cage who usually does a decent job. It's just a weird and disgusting movie with all sorts of disturbing images and yet it's not a horror movie at least for most of its duration. There is nothing redeeming about it. It's really one of the worst movies I have seen in the last decade.The beginning is never explained in the rest of the movie. We are just left hanging wondering why the beginning accident is at all related to the rest of the plot. The end is not satisfying at all. Why remake this movie. With so many other movies that have been wasted in the past why remake this POS of a story.

I can't understand what you after? Maybe it is to complicated for most of you but I thought this movie was just great! I just saw the premiere on the Luxumbourg Festival and I must say that this movie is not bad at all. I haven't seen the original in years but as far as I can remember me the first movie (one I truly liked) this remake is as good as the original! OK this isn't a horror movie pur-sang and maybe that is what most of you are after these days but to say that it is total crap...I can give you much more crap then this believe me! So for all you guys & girls out there go in & judge for yourself but go in with an open mind an I'm pretty surethis film will turn out very satisfying for you.Razor Reel

column4: Apparently the American audiences didn't "get" the original!!!
column5: PLEASE tell me my US cousins - that this isn't true.The original Wicker Man was dark kooky unsettling sexy claustrophobic and mysterious.There was nothing - NOTHING - intriguing about this "remake".The whole "goodie ending up kind of being a baddie for poking his nose in in the first place" twist (THE WHOLE POINT OF THE STORY) was lost in this ludicrous copy of an all time classic.Like I say - apparently the US audience didn't appreciate the subtle uneasiness of the original. I really hope that this is a lame excuse from some body in the department responsible for the PR for this pile of crap.Did they really think they could improve on the original? How arrogant can you get!!! I sincerely hope Christopher Lee is still in touch with some of those Orks (from lord of the rings) and he sets them on Nicolas Cage and the rest of the bozo cast.Truly laughably ridiculous.AVOID

column4: One of the stupidest movies ever made
column5: I did not enjoy this movie in the least. In fact I was awed by the stupidity and pointlessness of it. I resent having lost the couple of hours I wasted watching it. I kept hoping there would be something redeeming at the end. There wasn't a single redeeming factor. From beginning to end there were no likable characters. There was no continuity. There was no cohesion of either story line or character. There was no real tension. And while I might call the film laughable I couldn't even manage a chuckle. I pity poor Nicholas Cage for having been a part of this misogynist flop of a film. Don't waste your time or money on this one.

This movie looks alright I guess but in my opinion this Wicker man movie does not live up to the hype that the predecessor did back in the day. I have to say I was really surprised that Mr. Cage chose this part to be in this movie because it doesn't suit his trend of movies. Personally I think the only real undead movie he did was that whole ambulance driver dead persons movie that was not bad. He has always been the crazy bad guy and many other roles but undead talking ghost whisperer kind of guy I have to say no. This movie is probably as hyped as the VMA's was this week. Still if you are into this type of a flick go ahead and see it. Personally I'd rather see Starship Troopers again then this movie.
