I felt kinda sorry for the goats trapped in the human shaped sacrifice thing though... they didn't deserve that and you know it!!! I give The Wicker Man a 1 out of a 10 because the plot made no sense or whatsoever and the people were so phony that it made the movie stink like a giant fart. Thank you!

the wicker man has got to be one of the most heart stopping most occult thrillers of all cult/horror /thriller films.the reason its so disturbing in ways is that its so... strange and the whole island is a place of worship instead of a normal everyday island. in my opinion the scene were Nichole's cage goes on a hunt to find his daughter he notices that most of the people have been... mutilated in some way. this film is a bit like the Blair witch project because its occult but the Blair witch project doesn't have ceremony's of worship and initiation's of mutilation. (such as the scene when cage finds that man on the docks and finds that his eyes have been sown up). thank you.

column4: Nicholas Cage meets the island of PMS
column5: WOW! This film has even less of a plot then the movie "Cube." Nicholas Cage's acting was excellent of course but the poor man didn't have any kind of script to follow! Maybe they made up the movie as they went along. Seriously though there is absolutely no point to this movie and thats all there is to it. The Wicker Man is a film that keeps the viewers questioning "When will this get resolved?" Sadly it doesn't and once the ending credits hit the screen it left me laughing in my seat. If you're considering to buy it THEN DON'T! I wouldn't even spend the money to rent it. I'm telling you now if you take the time to watch it you'll only be wasting your time.

Just strange. The plot wasn't interesting or anything. It was just confusing and annoying. Basically Nicolas Cage yelling and over acting for the last hour. He normally sucks and over acts but it was worse than normal.

Well I thought the movie was absolutely fantastic. The story was not only perplexing but captivating as well. I don't agree with the majority of shuns of this film and reason may be that I have not had the opportunity to see the original film...so I have nothing to compare it to. I was amazed at Nicolas Cage's portrayal of Edward Malus and also the pagan people of Summersisle. The movie confused the hell out me and I found myself trying to grasp and infer all the information I could because I was trying to understand exactly what this movie was about. I felt that I could not quite comprehend until it finally ended. And then I still didn't understand. The reason being was because I did not understand why the community created this elaborate plan to lure and deceive a man who knew nothing of them that his ex fiancée would allow their daughter(allegedly) to set him afire why the townspeople sat there and watched a man burn to death. Essentially this is what makes the movie a must see for anyone despite the reviews. It allows you to think for yourself and in the end what you thought is not what is reality.

column4: Worst Movie Let Down In Years!
column5: I was utterly disappointed with this Nicholas Cage film. The previews lead you to believe that it is a some what horror suspense movie. No it was absolutely stupid. It was the worst waste of time spent watching a film in my life. I could have been sleeping and valued my time more! If you like "The Village" you might like this movie. The ending is nothing you would expect and leaves you with a feeling of emptiness instead of the normal feeling of satisfaction. Don't get your hopes up on this one. It is not a movie you would want to buy because you will not even want to watch it again. Nicholas Cage does very well in this movie as far as his acting goes but the movie itself is a let down. Spend your money more wisely and rent "Superman Returns" at least you will get a since of fulfillment when the credits roll. Whoever wrote this ridiculous script does not get out much and must thrive on those who want movies to end the way you expect. I do not recommend anyone who loves movies to watch this. It is not scary or thrilling it is a twisted plot from the beginning and a horrible upset at the end. If people like the ones portrayed in this movie exist they are sick individuals and should be condemned to a miserable life. Don't waste your time.

I haven't seen the original although I have heard of it. Unfortunately watching this version means I will the original when i do watch it will be rid of most of its tension without this version providing any of its own. The island characters were 2 dimensional with no real explanation of the islanders belief (the fact that they didn't like to oppression of women did not explain why they felt the need to burn a wicker man). There was no explanation as to why the men of island don't speak. The storyline was good but the film was made in such a way that it was entirely predictable unfortunately. When there were the odd few moments where I didn't guess what was going to happen to be quite honest I didn't care. The section with Nicholas Cage running around in a bear suit made me laugh out loud rather than recoil in terror. And the final scene with willow and Honey chatting up 2 men in a bar was a scene I should possibly have cared about but really didn't. Nicholas cage was unbelievable as a police officer. Praise Should go to the child actresses who did manage to be spooky and weird but this film should never have been remade

It was a horrible movie... basically cop sees girl die... is traumatized cop gets letter from ex fiancé who jilted him long time ago...letter says "my child is missing.. come to Summersisle and help me look for her.. here's her picture" so he goes to Summersile and finds his ex.. she's a bit psycho and delusional but he believes her anyway... "my kid's still on the island!!" and the island is full of paganistic women who worship this woman called sister summersisle... well let's see... so he looks all over the island for the kid who no one says existed until he finds her record in the schoolroom... so he freaks out and starts screaming at the kids "you're all liars" like he's a five year old and his ex tells him the kid's his... sooo he's even more frenzied and goes a bit whacko and finally finds out his kid is going to be sacrificed in a pagan ritual... so he goes and knocks out a few women saves the kid and runs through the forest with her... the kid leads him and eventually they get back to where Sister summersisle and the rest of the pagan women are... and he's captured and told that everything was just a plot to get the crops growing... OMG cuz we couldn't see that coming.. so they tell him the Kid and the ex planned it all and they're sister Summersisle's family... soo omg they break his legs and then SUSPEND him from them up into this wicker statue... (see THAT'S where the name of the movie came from... my GOD!!) and then he yells to his kid who most likely has no idea who he is "hunny don't light the statue on fire... please!!!" and she does... and he burns... then.... SIX MONTHS LATER!!!! his ex and another woman from the island are at a bar and they seduce two other men... THE END!!! it's like the worst movie i've seen in a long time! it's a Shyamalan wannabe and it has it's gruesome moments but other than that it's not scary and it's just dumb... i'm really sorry i wasted 8 bux to go see it...

What is with Nicolas Cage? Is he not in control of what movies he works in? Did he not know that Neil LaBute (Writer/Director) has written 6 films and direct them all to no significant success? He Directed one film that won some acclaim but was lucky enough to have not written it himself.The Cinematographer has worked in 70 films... 3 of which you may have heard of.The editor has worked 17 films and on most of LaButes drivel. Nothing on his resume to even suggest competency.This information took about 7 minutes to research.If you check you'll see cage is one of 19 producers. Can you imagine that meeting of minds? I think they may have had 20 but the smart one quit on the first day.I only looked this stuff in order to maybe find a glimmer of hope that cage might have had that this film wouldn't flop. There really is none.I also see that Cage has 5 films in production for 2007 and 5 more for 2008. I think he's just cashing in on any job he can get. He's gobbling up some cash and we're not going to see him for a few years.He's really had some stinkers lately... Ant Bully sucked... weather man sucked...I guess world trade center was good. I mean if I say it wasn't then I'm just not a good American right? Anyway all Cage did was lay in rubble and suffer for two hours.Synopsis:This movie was bad bad bad. I can't say one good thing about it or anyone that had anything to do with it.

column4: Don't waste your time or money!
column5: This film was probably in the worst four I've seen in the last two or three years. Nicolas Cage should fire his agent. He is too good to do this sort of film. The overall acting is far below par. The story is not that intriguing. This movie is not remotely scary like the trailers might have you believing. This is one of those movies that makes you say "Man Hollywood sure puts out tons of movies today. But is quantity a plus when quality suffers like this film indicates?" I would not even recommend this movie for a DVD rental. Time could be better spent re-watching a good movie one has already seen. I hope I've sufficiently advised you because I wish I would have read other's sentiments before checking this movie out!

column4: typical of a quick dirty remake of a great movie...
column5: Nicolas Cage just screams in the end. This misses the entire point of the original movie! In the end of the original movie the constable finally understanding that he cannot escape and will not survive begins to pray. The message of the original movie was that his Christian religion was no more effective than the villagers beliefs. Did no one else pick up on this? There are no difference between religions they are all just another way to control you by fear and threat. Blasphemy! I know. Think about it. Imagine no religion. All of the deaths the sacrifices (read the old testament!) Nothing the villagers did was worse than the history of Christianity. There were so many parallels in the pagan rituals and the Christian ones. Festivals (Christmas Easter) the wicker statue (altarchurch).

In some ways the movie was good because of Nick Cage and other interesting actors but the character development could have been much better.It began with a bang which made me think "Oh goody this is going to be fun" but quickly dragged it's cinematic feet.In some ways it was merely fair because it lacked the necessary edge and attention to details that make a movie very good.The writing acting cinematography sound track etc. seemed a bit lazy and like that of a "B" film.I think it is a good film for people who want something that is slow moving and not too scary.This is the kind of movie that should have gone straight to DVD or television; it would probably rate well in that venue.

OK so to sum up it was 2 hours and 22 minutes or so i'll never see again. On the plus side it has made me appreciate other films more. On the downside it was awful. The original Wicker Man was a masterpiece a suspenseful thriller with a powerful conclusion. This is not. the acting is atrocious and the script dire. The only entertainment that can be drawn from this film comes from mockery. The "How'd it get burned?!" montage about half way through the film for example or Nic Cage kicking that woman in the face provide brief moments of hilarity. it could be argued that Cage's character's eventual fate is preferable to watching this movie.

column4: See the original first - If you liked it see the remake
column5: The new Wicker Man movie is getting trashed left and right but that didn't deter me from seeing it last night. I wanted to share my thoughts on it.The original Wicker Man has a loyal cult following of which I am a card carrying member. What's special about the film is that it's so original - I can't think of another movie to compare it to. The fact that it's so different means that it does not have universal appeal. I know of two people who tried to watch it but lost interest in the first act.As a big fan of the 1973 version (especially the extended version) I was excited to see the remake despite the reviews. I really enjoyed it because you can tell that the screenwriter/director had respect and affection for the original film. What the new director accomplished was a tribute to the original with many of the same scenes re-shot. At the same time he inserted his own ideas and twists which worked for me. The remake by no means challenges the original's greatness. Rather it has its flaws and silly scenes. I understand how anyone who hasn't seen the original may not be impressed by the remake because they don't have the context to appreciate the redone scenes.Recent remakes that I hated were King Kong and Planet of the Apes. Granted I'm loyal to the 1976 King Kong and Peter Jackson was remaking the 1933 version. But with all the technical effects of the 2005 version it failed to make you sympathize with the beast that the 1976 version did for me.As for Planet of The Apes Tim Burton (who is great) spoofed the original film if anything. I felt that he did not have any respect for the 1968 version as a sci-fi classic.Back to The Wicker Man I broke down and bought the wooden box edition on eBay. The extended version is so much better I thought. The story makes more sense taking place over two nights instead of one and the additional scenes really help the story line.Anyways I think fans of the original will enjoy the remake of The Wicker Man like I did.

I am so terrifically disappointed in this film that I feel compelled to immediately get the highly regarded and lauded 1973 British original to view as a form of an antidote of some kind. I thought to myself "If Nicolas Cage is in it how bad could it be?". Now I sadly realize - that is far from any quality guarantee - this film is pretty awful.Reading the many reviews it seems that the original is as good as this one is bad. The only thing good about this film is some of the scenic location shots. Otherwise the whole film is absolutely dreadful at every level.The one scene in the film I would like to comment on is toward the end of the film when Nicolas Cage's character is running around the island looking for his daughter. He comes out of a house and suddenly has this look on his face like he just saw the most horrible sight imaginable. (Nicolas Cage is a great actor - so making this expression well is what a great actor does - and he does it very well.) The scene then cuts to simply show that his bike was taken. Then the scene cuts back to his face and looks slightly annoyed and he starts running.How bizarre is that? It disrupts the already lumbering creaking pseudo-momentum in a way that is laughable and seems as if it was done as a joke.I also have to add that the dialog and plot progression was so bad that I found myself groaning and complaining out loud DURING the film. That is something I very rarely do.Don't waste your time seeing this bewildering wreck of a movie. I am going to go find the 1973 British original...

What is the point of this film? Remember the remake of Psycho. What kind of brain dead executives say its OK to throw millions o fdollars remaking a classic and then adding nothing to it? Burton pulled off 'Planet of the Apes' because he reimagined it. But here there is a scene by scene remake of the 1973 classic as an attempt to make a quick buck. As usual the only appeal will be for those who haven't seen the original and those who will watch with anger at how the seminal Hammer film is being desecrated by this unimaginative rehash of the classic. Nicholas Cage who can be a great actor in the right role must have been cast for this following the comments of 'Captain Corelli's Mandolin' that he had no sexual spark with his actress. So then suitable for the role of the virginal police officer sent to investigate the disappearance of the girl on the Scottish Island. Just stick with the original 1973 film

column4: An example of how to dumb down a good film for a US audience
column5: Go see the original of The Wicker Man it's already in English so why translate it to English and move it from Scotland to Washington (Canada). It's interesting that a Mormon director is incapable of imagining a believable adult virgin character and so has to make unsubtle tweaks to the plot. This film can be summarised by the image of Neil LaBute holding up the American flag whilst wearing a dunce hat and proclaiming that Julias Ceaser displaced the Gauls northward to Washington (a state of Canada). It seems the Pictish folk of Washington have kept up their sacrificial traditions since Roman times when they escaped to America as Julias Ceaser invaded.

I'm not a big movie critic (first post) but this one shoved me to it. I never saw the original I'm tempted to now though but...wow. Besides The Blair Witch Project I've never watched a more pointless and non-conclusive movie in my short life. You invest the little piece of your life to watch this movie and it seems genuinely worthwhile and interesting. Even right up to the last 10-15 minutes or so of the movie it is suspenseful and you want to know what will happen next. Then the downslope of the ending comes. I'm not going to spoil it but it just drops off. I don't want to start a big religious fight over a movie but I think unless you're a Pagan and believe in the stuff that's happening you won't really enjoy it either. Nicholas Cage is one of my favorite actors and I think that this is definitely a big stain on his otherwise awesome career. Again I don't mean to offend those of the Pagan faith or any other faith and I also apologize if I did. This film is just absolutely ridiculous. I'm just thankful that all I did was rent it otherwise it would be on the Used rack at Blockbuster along with a good sized pile of other peoples copies. Thank you for reading my comment.

column4: The Best Comedy of All Time
column5: After hearing of the "shocking" ending through the internet I decided to watch this movie. It was the greatest decision I made today. If you've heard about this movie prior to watching it then you know it's terrible.Reasons to watch this film if you are on the fence:Nic Cage walks around the woods for hours. Nic Cage's police-douche friend has a picture of a gun on his computer monitor. Violent flashbacks/dreams involving little girls. Car crashes. Bratty little girls throwing dolls out of moving vehicles requiring police officer Cage to lean on his motorcycle to pick up the doll in the road. Moody boat rides. "...Mr. Grant here and his twin brother Ulysses." Empty planes. Bike rides through the forest. Nic Cage punching several women. Nic Cage punching a woman to steal her bear costume. Paternity. A funnel used specifically to dump bees into a wire helmet.

I don't remember the Wicker Man being as bad as everyone claims it to be. The internet absolutely hates this movie at best and remembers some of its many unintentionally hilarious moments. Indeed Neil LaBute's The WICKER Man is the embodiment of the so bad it's good cinema. The plot is such that a Sherriff encounters a strange bunch of people on an island as he tries to solve the mystery of an abducted girl. One problem this film faces is that the original Wicker Man was a very well-remembered chilly feature film featuring a creepy atmosphere. But that does not explain Cage's descent into madness as he hams it way up even by his high standards. The scenes of him punching a woman in a bear suit or him crying out "Not the bees "could not have been taken seriously by anyone on the set whilst filming. It is bizarre how no-one stood up and everyone just went along. If you can overlook the unintentional hilarity (or roll with it) the film does have some nice scenery.

When I saw this film I couldn't help think that it wasn't so much a remake but rather a remix of the earlier classic crossed with a made for TV film called Harvest Home which was written by ( I think) Thomas Trydon and which came out either in the 1970s or 1980s. Certainly it seemed to borrow more heavily from that book/film than from the original version of the Wicker Man which dealt more I think with the pagan aspect than this film did. I really couldn't see why Neil La Bute Nicholas Cage or Ellen Burstyn would want to be bothered with such a weak and unnecessary exercise. In my view it failed to add anything to the original which I still think is one of the best chillers of all time. I would be interested to hear whether other people agree with the Harvest Home connection.

OK. I like Nicholas Cage but this was not a good job move for him! The movie was slower than molasses in January and it just made me leave feeling like I should have seen Gridiron gang with my husband! First of all once he gets to the island the rude people ask how he got there and they assumed the pilot so you knew the pilot was gonna get killed and he did.Secondly nobody would give him straight answers throughout the whole movie which would leave one to assume he was stupid for not beating it out of them! Then they burn him at the end? Hello? Not to mention the little "parade" of weirdo women romping about the countryside dressed up in masquerade attire. It was corny! And Lelee Sobieski? She should have stayed home for the filming. Her character gave absolutely nothing to the movie and when she tries to attack him a shovel to his head would have worked but she jumps on him and screams. Um he's a cop with training.The acting was pretty much a loss even for Nick and the only thing that made the movie was the beautiful scenery. Otherwise it stunk and made me mad that I wasted my time. I don't usually write comments like this but it was an awful movie! It wasn't scary or suspenseful as it was made out to be in the reviews and with the exception of Nicks 1 "F" word usage could have been PG.Oh well that's what I get for not having cable TV or getting the paper delivered to read the critics reviews first! Don't waste your time!

Why are Nicolas Cage and Ellen Burstyn in this movie? I identify both of these people with having had many quality roles over the years. Why would either consider being in this ridiculous film? Absolutely one of the worst films I have seen in many years. And I'm usually very forgiving and try to find good points in a film. There just are not many in this one.The first 10 to 15 minutes might be considered to be a good start to an exciting film. But that's about all there is.I could not figure out why this film was shown to a crowd of older people on a Saturday night. This is obviously made for the 10 - 14 year old age group and even that group would find many problems with this movie.Hopefully all cast members will move on to better work in the future including the writers.

column4: Not all of us islanders are like that
column5: Just so everyone knows.. Being from the area.. we do have some unique island hippy like characters.. and yes they do dress up in strange outfits and yes they do have some fun and interesting ceremonies However when a man comes to an island to do good.. We do not necessarily kill him because the bees won't put out.. Yes. that really is the plot of this movie.. Yes.. it really is that bad.. I want to see it again.. just to see if it really was that bad.. What was Nicholas Cage thinking when he agreed to put his name on this.. We all even agreed that the music was like something out of a 1950's Hitchcock movie.. all that dramatic riffs and orchestrated .. maybe we can make this one of those bad movies that develops a cult following because its so bad.. Like for instance.. revenge of the killer tomato'sI have to say.. this is the worst movie I have ever seen.. bar none

column4: Cage what in the heck was you thinking
column5: I am so disgusted this is one of the Most Crappiest movies I have ever seen. Cage what in the heck was you thinking. You are a much better actor. you don't need to waste your time with a crap movie you should have seen when you read the script it was a waste of time. Poor scene's bad actors all the way through. I can't believe I wasted two hours on this. Don't waste your time. I know one thing I am sure glad I didn't buy this movie I would have really been mad. 15 thumbs down.This movie needs burned in the Wicker Man. I think it would be best to stay with Stephen King Movies he never disappoint's you that is for sure. This movie just makes me want to scream....................................

column4: What the HE-double-hockey stick did I just see?
column5: I am shocked..!? I have absolutely no idea what happened during the I don't know two hours or so of my time...I know there is a 70's version of this film and I am sure  no doubt will reconcile the regurgitation in my mouth at this time.I felt as if I was watching some B-version of a great film that should have been made. Neil LaBute... What happened???? You are a great storyteller one of which I and the rest of your fans expect a precision... beyond this movie! Nick Cage Ellen Burstyn Molly Parker Leelee Sobieski!!! Please!! These are fine fine actors that have capable skills far beyond this miserable script.The story was disjointed poorly executed and without a real dynamic that makes for a lasting picture. I am disappointed and totally speechless.Do I give you a mulligan on this one...? I do not know?

This is quite possibly the WORST movie in the history of cinema. At least in the echelons of major motion pictures. It almost makes you wonder if Nicholas Cage was in dire need of money which is the only reason I can fathom that he would accept such a horrible role. I am actually a Nick Cage fan. I loved "The Rock" "Gone in 60 Seconds" and about 10 other movies of his that are some of my all-time favorites but his reason for accepting this role is a real puzzler.The script is ridiculous and extremely confusing. The story lines are never explained which leaves you scratching your head. The casting was pathetic. The acting was laughable. The entire movie was one big waste of 2 hours of my life.I am honestly considering writing a letter to Millennium Films and ask that they somehow refund the 2 hours of my life I wasted by watching this "movie".

I don't quite understand all these negative reviews. The movie is not a masterpiece but it was fun to watch on TV on Sunday night. And that's all that matters of this type of a movie. I gave it 10 for: 1-Holding my attention to the very end; 2-For not having a happy end (not typical for a Hollywood movie). Not the ending majority would expect/want/like. I think that's the real reason people are giving mostly negative reviews; 3-I liked how main character treats crazy women. I was laughing after he made his first punch )) 4-For making me go to IMDb and write my first review ) 5-and to contribute to movie's rating on IMDb because I think it must be in 5-6 area. Many thanks to Nicolas for good work!

Actually I did not like this movie too much but I am reading the reviews and they make me want to like the movie just so that I do not have to associate with the people who trashed it. First of all I never saw the original. OHHH I know. That is apparently blasphemy! Too Bad! I didn't see it and I may if it ends up on my TiVo but I don't know why 80% of the criticism of this movie is about not living up to the original. It just seems pompous to me as if the critics are making sure the world knows "I saw the original and it was much better". Then I saw some people who obviously are Bee experts because they somehow knew what was going to happen when Nick Cage killed the bee at the bar. SORRY but what little I learned about bee colonies I FORGOT 20 years ago. And while I did guess what was going to happen at some point it WASN'T because of any bee references. Sorry. I didn't know you needed a degree in science to watch a horror movie. And I hope I am wrong about this but it seems like everyone hated the end because the hero didn't win???? REALLY????? REALLY????? It is a horror movie after all.Now on to my criticisms. I hated how carefully they explained the plot at the end when they trapped Cage. I just hate movies that are written for people who can't understand stuff on their own. All that was needed was the little girl to say to her mom "Mommy did I do it right" and the whole plot should unfold for anyone of average intelligence. Then the final slap in the face was the end sequence. As soon as I saw "6 months later" I knew exactly what was going to happen. I would have actually been OK with that scene being left in IF they didn't do that play by play explanation earlier. That would have been a good way to let the people who didn't quite understand what happened catch up.I thought is was OK and the story was sufficiently interesting. I will watch the original to see how I feel then.

column4: Destined to be a cult classic
column5: Nicholas Cage looked seriously ill in this movie which no doubt he will never want to see. The inconsistencies and implausibilities became so numerous that the movie soon evolved into a sick version of a Shakespearean comedy. The reversal of Lord Summersisle from the original to Lady Summersisle appears to be a result of political correctness rather than to enhance the story. However I predict that this will eventually become a cult classic in the same vein as Ed Wood's famous flick and Rocky Horror with all of the same regalia to follow. I recommend you pick up the 1973 version on DVD for a much better rendition of this tale.

column4: The ending makes this a waste of time........
column5: The wicker man remake had great potential of being a good movie however it fails...miserably. The entire movie is a waste of time because from the minute Cage sets foot on the island the islanders could have locked him up and waited for the time to start the ritual. There is no reason for him to spend days searching for his child that is actually not missing. It is just cruel to both the character AND the viewers. I could not believe i sat through an hour and a half just to see him burn with no real reason. Other viewers of the remake have also brought up the point that they are a bee colony and it looked as though they had many bees and much honey there seemed to be no real reason to sacrifice Cage's character. Unlike the original which dealt with growing fruits on an island in/near Scotland which would require some help from a ritual sacrifice.All in all i felt the acting in the movie was good the story line was solid...until the ending. Then when you are introduced to the insanity and craziness that is the plot the movie drops to nothing special. if you MUST see this wait for video.

I never saw the original. This movie is now the single worst movie that I have ever seen. Catwoman and Romi and Michelle move up a notch. I wish I would have came to this site before renting this movie. I almost always check out the comments before I rent a movie. I just thought this movie was so lame and inept and horrible that I wasted 1 hour and 45 minutes of my life watching this. I really like Nick Cage and this movie made me realize that CON AIR was a pretty good movie. I really wish the movie company would reimburse my rent money for this and if you think I am being to harsh on this movie. Read what other people are saying or god forbid rent it. I would even dare to say I would not watch this movie if it was given to me. Spend you 105 minutes watching grass grow or running your finger nails up and down a chalk board.

Oh boy is "Wicker Man" a stinker! To save you from what I had to learn the hard way let me try to recreate here for deterrence purposes -- The Wicker Man Experience:1. Nicholas-Cage-character (showing photo of missing girl): "Have you seen this girl?"2. Replaceable-female-character: "I like cookies!"3. (Now hit yourself over the head with a bedpan)4. (Repeat steps 1-3 approx. 4.800 times.)Intermixed with this basic theme imagine:a) Little-girl-character actually outrunning Nicholas-cage-character on an open field -- way to go Nicholas-cage-character!b) Nicholas-cage-character discovering dead-guy-character when suddenly: Replaceable-female-characters-dressed-up-as-forest-animals pop up behind a hedge like whack-a-mole-moles to watch Nicholas-cage-character discovering dead-guy-character (yes this is for real!) Nicholas-cage-character turns around -- Replaceable-female-characters-dressed-up-as-forest-animals hide behind the hedge again. Way to go screen writing-director-guy-Neil-LaBute! Why this one didn't get you an Oscar remains a mystery to me ...c) Nicholas-cage-character punching some replaceable-female-character in the face (which was actually refreshing to see and should have been extended to Nicholas-cage-character punching _all_ replaceable-female-characters in the face and then punching himself in the face until he passes out -- this might have saved the movie)5. At the end Nicholas-cage-character dies....6. But is it _really_ the end? No! In a special and totally unexpected twist we are threatened with the possibility of ... A SEQUEL! Expect it to be filmed as soon as enough influential people have been promised sexual favors again.

Believe me you'll be VERY GLAD you read this even though it's a spoiler.As I was watching this movie I thought it was kind of neat. The guy's (Nicholas Cage) daughter was missing on some weird island (the island's inhabitants are what made it weird) and he was searching for her. The movie was pretty good until the end when I found out the truth. It turns out the entire "your daughter is missing" thing was just a scheme to get him to come onto the island so that those outrageous pagans could sacrifice him! They sacrificed him at the very end and then two girls went out to find to more guys to sacrifice for later. There is no other movie in existence that stinks as much as this one does. I would actually pay someone to destroy every copy of this movie in existence.Some things the movie tried to tell me (that I of course don't agree with): 1) Women are evil. 2) Having sex with women can have dire consequences (i.e. being sacrificed). 3) Never go to strange islands to find your daughter. You may find her but you'll never come out alive.You get the idea. This movie was horrible.

column4: Do something else with your time!
column5: Waste of time to watch this. Ugh. I can never get this time back. If you like Nicholas Cage like I do you're going to wonder why he didn't get talked out of doing this. Why didn't anyone talk him out of doing this!!???

column4: Bad movie. Even when you think it cant be that bad it gets worse.
column5: Bad movie. Even when you think it cant be that bad it gets worse. I was prepared to see a bad movie but of this caliber? I cant believe i saw this crap. Nicolas cage just couldn't go more down.. And what's next? Ghost Rider? Jesus. Christ. You wanna know what'w even worse? The two movies that I saw before the Wicker Man were "Litle Man" (My rating is 1) and "The triangle" (Rating 2). Will the next movie be worse? I doubt it very much. I have another three lines to write some crap so that this site will accept my effort of trying to prevent you to see this movie. Don't SEE THIS MOVIE unless you have a gun on your head you get money or a really hot chick asks you to (and of course you are gonna get laid later on). Please someone kill Nicolas Cage.

Mind you...this is the first time ever I have commented on a movie so thats how bad it really was. I'm sorely disappointed with this movie. I should have read all these comments first before wasting my money on renting the DVD. It was the WORST movie I have seen in quite awhile. Just horrible...please don't waste your money!!! Not sure why this makes your write 10 lines but I suppose I'll comply to the guidelines so my opinion is heard. The movie was just confusing and I was left with a whole lot of questions. The movie itself just made me ill afterwards....just a feeling of disgust. Not a fan of Nicholas Cage so this can be added to the many other films I dislike of his.

Nicholas Cage delivers a one-note performance in a predictable and uncompelling thriller. Cage is invited by a former fiancé to an isolated feminist commune where he investigates the disappearance of her daughter. There he discovers a female-led cult with mysterious rituals and practices. The cult's misandrist attitudes reflect director Neil LeBute's continuing fascination with the subject of gender wars; however unlike such previous efforts as "In the Company of Men" which looks at its male characters' misogyny in lurid detail "The Wicker Man" uses the cult's hatred of men as a superficial plot device. This leaves only the mystery of the little girl's disappearance the answer to which many viewers -- even those who haven't seen the original -- will see coming from a mile away.

column4: A great performance from Nicolas Cage.
column5: I read some of the other review titles and honestly I couldn't disagree more I thought it was an amazing remake of a sadistic tale and it was brought back to life by the talents of Nicolas Cage. Although I thought it could have been explained about a bit better maybe with Edward reading a diary in the background but otherwise it was truly tremendous acting from all in this. Also some of the smaller things in it weren't thought out as well for instance; When Edward was stuck in the water hole at the old church he manged to hold on to the metal cover for over eight or more hours which is physically impossible as far as i'm aware. Well worth a watch. A sadistic classic brought back to work by the great acting of Nicolas Cage

Very underrated. People don't understand that this could make a great dark comedy. Even the great Cage said it himself. Sure it was categorized as a horror but the important thing is how we see a movie. Maybe it wouldn't be good if we view it one way but if we view it differently then we can enjoy this film. I mean you get to see Nic Cage do a bunch of wacky stuff like wear a bear suit. I mean what more do you need? Nicolas Cage shows that he can portray really any role from something like The Wickerman to serious roles such as Leaving Las Vegas. People say that Cage's career went down with roles like this but in reality it shows how capable of an actor he is. He can be serious in some scenes to absolutely crazy in another. This is shown best in this movie. From a serious conversation to the outrageous infamous "bee scene." It shows the Cage's skill as an actor and he can really portray any kind of character.

column4: guy gets a letter from ex fiancé about missing child and he goes and tries to find her.
column5: i think that people should see this movie. the actors/actresses did an awesome job. i was on the edge of my seat the whole time. People just don't know how to accept a movie that doesn't have blood and people dying all the time.i like all types of movies but i get tired of all gory stuff this movie didn't have hardly any bloody stuff.the movie even made my parents jump a lot. Nicholas cage was awesome in this movie. I'm not a huge fan of him but i like him and he was excellent in this movie.the other people in the movie were suspicious and they were really good at keeping secrets. the scenery was also very pretty.the views were also really pretty. they also did a great job on the set. and the costumes

This is one movie that never needed to be remade full stop. I liked the idea of the island being run by girls lol but like most things in this film it never really worked. The casting was v clumsy. just awful really. a lot of people left during the screening which says a lot doesn't it? all the best parts of the film were put into the trailer but seeing them in the context in film was disappointing. mrs summersisle was pretty lame compared to c.lee. Nicolas cage trying to wise crack his way thru the island!!!. where was the Christian versus pagan element so fundamental to the first film???. it seemed as if the director had never seen the original!!

column4: A very interesting film with the worst ending i've ever seen
column5: I'm a fan of Nicholas Cage so against what people said I rented this movie.It was really good till the last 15 minutes. Then the whole thing flopped. Everything that had made the movie good before was shattered. I wanted Nick to blow the brains out of the lady who was leading the village thing. But no she had to take the bullets out of his gun.Then Nick is burned alive and two girls go out to get more people.If they had just let Nicholas Cage blow everyone's brains out and make it out alive I would have considered buying it. But unfortunately my wish didn't come true.Go see the movie if you like depressing films that take away the whole plot with the ending. Like I said before the movie would have been great if they had made a better ending. But the ending screwed it up so bad I have to give this film a 2.I suppose the only spoiler here is that I tell the ending but its a spoiler.

Let me just start by saying that I've never seen the original movie. Good OK that's out of the way. I liked this movie because it didn't have your normal "conflict against a religious cult ending". Cage was tricked fair and square. No two ways about it. Normally Cage would have found some way out of his predicament with the cultists and gotten away from the island or back-up would have arrived at the last second...But NO! He ended up being the sucker to a devious and secretive cult's plan for sacrifice. But come on at least he didn't freaking imagine the whole thing or some other clichéd ending like we've seen from recent suspense/horror/mystery flicks. As stated before I realize that this movie is a remake. I think I speak for a lot of movie fans when I say "ENOUGH WITH THE DANG REMAKES ALREADY!" but this one I actually liked. Perhaps it was because the bad guys won in the end. I don't know. It was suspenseful and I'm sure all of us were glad to see cage knock the crap out of a few deranged cultists like he should have done from the start. Alright it wasn't the best movie but it deserved higher that a 3.3 for crying out loud.

column4: what in the world was wrong with Nicolas when he was reading this script ?
column5: i liked the movie so far except the last minute  i was waiting for the great plot. what in the world was wrong with Nicolas cage when he was reading the script . they told him  hey we let you search your daughter  but in stead of a great plot where you save her and you are the hero  we just let you burn in the end and you loose  what about that end ? do you like that end? Nicolas ? uh OK he must have said ...... ? ? ? ? i want to forget this movie. there should be an official federal agency to prohibit this kind of bad stupid endings in big production movies i am sure 99% of the audience didn't like the end and that killed the whole movie. everything was fine until the movie was suddenly starting the credits in the end. i couldn't believe it .i guess something was definitely wrong with the producers fantasy and director. what were they thinking ? a big smash hit movie because Nicolas now plays in it ? this is a feel bad movie  a lot of people got angry after pay and see this ...

This film made me turn my back on remakes everything about it was weak. From a morbid storyline to a lip bitingly poor acting from the 'cage' and cast crew. I would seriously recommend seeing the original and giving this a wide birth as you will only find yourself regretting watching this. Its hard to really point out a strong point to this movie but twisting my arm i would say once the credits had rolled up... no seriously. I was hoping for a lot more from this movie. Its one of those films which every once in a while bursts into your head reminding yourself of the torture you had to endure watching this so called 'film'. 1/10

This is a movie i had always avoided as i read some real bad reviews on it..Now i can see why...The original had atmosphere an ambiance that had you gripped music that was a perfect twin for the scenes.. This one? Well it has nothing to offer but a cheap B movie kinda vibe or an American TV afternoon movie.Only good thing about it was the end credits to be honest although i do love Nicholas Cage. His acting was pretty good as always though the rest of the cast offered no sense of fear not in the same way the original did..

One wonders if Nicolas Cage read the script before he showed up on the set for the production of this film. You find yourself asking "Is this a horror movie?" "Is it a crime drama?" "How about a psycho-thriller?" A quarter of the way in you're not sure if you want to switch theaters. Halfway through you wished you had but figure there must be some merit to this flick; after all the photography is great. Three quarters through you find yourself antsy to just leave and who cares what happens. This is an M. Night Shyamalan wannabe without any positive uplifting message. It wasn't worth the money for the ticket and I wouldn't buy the DVD. It gets a "3" simply for the photography.

This movie started out really well but it was totally ruined by the ending. When the movie was over all I could think was "WHAT"????? Without giving away too much the morbid ending seemed totally out of place with the rest of the film. So much of it was unnecessary and didn't even make sense. To sum it up I would have to say it was definitely "overkill". Other than what I consider to be a very poor ending parts of the movie were actually riveting although there were too many inconsistencies. I found myself wondering how these women could second guess so many things and know exactly how the Nicolas Cage character would react. This movie was a real waste of good talent. Don't waste your time or money on this one.

column4: Make sure to watch it as a comedy and nothing more!
column5: As has been mentioned here numerous times as a horror movie "The Wicker Man" (2006) is absolutely horrible. Easily one of the worst movies I've ever seen. As a comedy however...Nicolas Cage is pure gold! Somewhere along the movie it seemed like Cage stopped taking it seriously and amped up the camp factor to about 11. All of a sudden he's questioning about a burned doll beating up women dressing up as a bear...beating up more women and then of course...the hilarity during the sacrifice. "NOT THE BEES!"As a horror movie I can only give it 1 star out of 10 but it gets a bonus 5 stars for Nicolas Cage hamming it up in the worst way...the only way to handle a piece of turd like this. My total score: 6 out of 10.

I can only remain hopeful that the "Wicker Man" was an elaborate hoax on the movie viewing public and that in a few months it will be disclosed that in lieu of a class action suit Cage will offer a real movie free of charge! I plan to acquire a few copies for Christmas gifts for those who will appreciate the howling humor in the comfort of their own homes! How could this have happened?!! Do they make movies without viewing the dailies? Was Nicholas Cage in another location and they hired someone to swim in the sewer punch and kick the women and unbelievablyput on a bear suit without his knowledge? Was Ellen Burstyn drugged and dragged into this fiasco? Is she that afraid of "Depends" commercials?

The only thing that prevented me from walking out of the cinema was the fact that i knew he was going to get burned alive! But even that wasn't as good as it could have been. I wasted 2 hours of my life in that cinema and i want them back!Most of the acting was terrible there was a distinct lack of horror and suspense and I don't know where to begin describing how awful Nick Cage robbing the woman of the bear suit was.This film could possibly be the worst film i have ever seen and I've seen some rubbish. Why did they have to attempt to remake a perfectly good film and how did they go so wrong?For Shame!

Well made and flawlessly acted. Nicolas Cage is a good actor and did all he possibly could with the script. Again well directed - But!I am no fan of remakes which are just mindless identical copies of the originaland there is nothing wrong with contemporising them but they should understand and keep an eye on the things which make the original good. Here the script lost most of the well researched history of paganism and its rituals in favour posh looking books and 'Buffy' style explanations. Also the ending here was weak and predictable - something the original really could not be accused of!The good acting and filming support what is a weak script which has - unsurprisingly - Americanised the setting (thus losing the history and pagan roots ) and Hollywoodised the story (no depth and predictable with the slack taken up by special effects and sensationalism). Hollywood please remember - Jumpiness is not the same as suspense sudden scares are not the same as horror.In all - well acted and directed but poorly written losing all the good stuff from the original but keeping the sensational irrelevant bits in.

This movie had me cracking up from the opening 10 minutes when it was supposed to do the exact opposite of that. A pointless film and a huge blemish in Nick Cage;s portfolio. First of all the dialog is full of pointless garbage half the time it sounds like it was written by a 11 year old the other half it just makes little sense and has no depth at all. There are no interesting aspects to this movie and makes absolutely no sense. The character build up is non existent and u cant help but laugh at Cage's wardrobe elbow patch;s at all. Don't waste money on this movie. To make a long story short this movie is terribleif it weren't for the people i went to see it with wanting to stay i would've left 15 minutes into it.

I think this is a great movie contrary to the opinions of others. If you are the type of idiot who likes to watch the cliché movie then don't watch it. If you have a brain and would like it to be stimulated then maybe this movie is for you. Their are many elements that coalesce to create an ideal movie experience. First there are many class issues; this film functions a strong criticism of white male patriarchy taking Nicolas Cages character to an isolated island and forcing him to experience the uncanny. It is disturbing only in so far as many of the symbols (phallic of course a white male police officer) are displaced in a society that is modeled off of a colony of bees. That is this place is a complete matriarchy. The women here run the island. I don't want to categorized the movie as femmenist but it is surely tends towards direction.

column4: Seriously it isn't all that bad
column5: Going into watching this film I had seen the 1973 version and I'd read a lot (a whole lot) of disparaging comments about this one. Most of these negative comments were from devotees of the original version rather than an unbiased criticism of the film by itself.As most know this film involves a cop who is summoned to an island named for its administrator Summersisle to investigate the missing child of his ex-fiancée. He runs into road block after road block among the island's inhabitants which understandably frustrates him to no end.As a stand alone film it isn't a bad movie. The characters aren't too poorly constructed though they could have been better. The plot seems to flow fairly well from point to point which is primarily Edward trying to figure out what the heck is going on. Yes quite a few liberties were taken with the original Shaffer script but these liberties seemed to tie the story together a bit differently than the original version.As with any film there were some rather silly moves that make one shake their head but these are really not discussable without spoiling a little here and there. Suffice to say it's not perfect but few films are.So in the end I did not watch a movie that stunk. If this shared the slate with the likes of Manos Date Movie or Friday the 13th Part VIII I would be the first to say so but it wasn't that bad. If you have seen the original prepare for a different film with a similar plot.

My general rule of thumb when visiting a place is if it doesn't have a tourist board then forget it.This film was well hmmmm aaaalright. To be fair it really depends on what you look for in a film. Not everything you see is going to be something you'd want to own on DVD and not everything is going to be inspiring. It passed a couple of hours and I wasn't bored so that's good enough for me.However the lass that played the ex-love interest (forgot her name that's how good she was) was irritating at best. Nicholas Cage has never been great but we all tend to just put up and shut up in order to get over it.All in all it's a decent story and good for those who never saw the original and would never have seen either version had this not been made.It kept me gripped enough to feel like I'd had an enjoyable visit to the cinema.The major criticism I have of it is that it is a scary story but a wimpy version. The tension and fear should have been cranked up and made this at least a 15.

I never would've seen this film if Neil LaBute's name wasn't attached to it. I appreciate some of his earlier films such as "In the Company of Men" and "Your Friends and Neighbors." "The Wicker Man" is nothing like those movies except perhaps in that it reveals the director's understated sense of humor.I read some nutshell reviews of this film on RottenTomatoes after I had already seen it and one of them caught my eye. It said that the result of the film was unintentionally hilarious. I agree that it was hilarious but I certainly think LaBute appreciated the humor. For example when Nicholas Cage was storming around the island near the film's climax kicking down doors waving his gun around beating up weird pagan women and very much acting the part of Bruce Willis in "Die Hard" I couldn't help but laugh. His approach is just so unsubtle and inappropriate for the situation that I suspected his efforts would be futile.In the end when Cage burns alive LaBute might show us a lot of gore if this were a horror film. He doesn't and it isn't. The epilogue left me smiling. I like how effortless it is for the two women in the bar. They just walk in sit down and immediately two men fall into their trap and their fate is sealed. The women hardly have to say a word because the men are eager to pursue them. I reckon this is a bit of observational humor from LaBute.I find the whole idea of this island of evil women who enslave and murder men to be a bit of irony on LaBute's part. He is not showing us how things are--rather he is showing us the extreme opposite in part at least I am sure for comic effect. Some viewers I have no doubt will find the film sexist. They will have mistaken its tone(which is rather inconsistent and probably contributed to my opinion that this film is only slightly above average of stuff I see).

If you enjoyed the previews for this film go no further. This happens to be one of those instances were the trailer is grossly misleading. My friend and I went to the theater totally prepared for a sort of "8mm" meets the supernatural universe but the only remotely supernatural things that happen in this movie are merely dream sequences. Plot devices are weak several of them serving little or no purpose to conflict progression or resolution and all "horror" scenes are simply gimmicks to make the audience jump (not to mention badly telescoped with overabundant "scary music"); none is a serious threat to the character and all are easily resolved. Without spoiling the ending I will say only that it is thoroughly unsatisfying. A film that does not live up to its marketing campaign or Nick Cage's better performances.

column4: Wow. All I can say is Wow.
column5: First off let me say Nicholas Cage is the love of my life. Had to say that about this hearthrob and get it off my chest. That is the only thing that kept me watching this movie. Seeing my hearthrob. This movie was supposed to be sooooooooo good! The trailers were excellent and of course it had Mr. Cage in it. I was looking forward to seeing it and got it on Netflix. Couldn't wait to watch it. The beginning was alittle slow and the middle I didn't quite understand (i was just watching Nick with his tight shirt on) :) And the ending was terrible! Absolutely TERRIBLE! never expected it for second though. It was a great storyline. You know guys ex-fiancées lost her daughter he has to go save her. BUt then....ohkay i'll spare you and YOU can see it yourself. If you want to I mean.Anyway terrible movie hot guy=4

At this point in entertainment history saleability has become the leading factor in determining a project's go ahead. Every successful film of the last 40 years (even those of Asia and Europe)is being remade and mostly with disastrous results. Of all the hideous reinterpretations of recent years The Wicker Man takes the prize for the worst. The original 1973 film is a believable masterpiece with a setting although a fantasy that has an authenticity due to it having drawn on a real history. The re-make is a misguided attempt to relocate this historically founded story to a country that isn't old enough to have had such beliefs. The entire symbolism of the original is lost. Blind faith virginity ignorance self-righteousness and temptation lead the original cop through the maze of experience to prove his worthiness. Nicholas Cage has none of these traits and is just a pawn in a ludicrous plot. The only good thing about this film is it has rekindled people's desire to see the original again and experience it's hypnotic charm.

To be honest this film only got a 1 because thats the lowest on the rating scale. Anyone who rates it above 6 has either not seen the original or is American. Nothing wrong with Americans but we have very different views on films. The entire point of the original Wickerman is to explore how virginal Christian God-fearing policeman Howie (Cage in remake) behaves when sent to a pagan island and about being the minority group and loneliness and translation between two different religions Rowan is the means to get him there to start the story. The remake is an action film not a horror and entirely based on finding Rowan not giving a rats ass about the original story. If it weren't for the burning Wickerman at the end there bears nearly no resemblance to the original. It misses the entire point and shouldn't be linked to the cult classic from the 70s at all because its almost a completely different story. If I hadn't paid £6 and had nothing else to do I would have walked out of the cinema after 30 minutes.

column4: funniest movie i have seen in while
column5: I just watched this movie and you may question why i gave this movie such a high rating. I loved this movie it is easily one of the funniest movies I have seen in years. Nicholas Cage demonstrates through out the movie how he is an ass kicking machine. No one can kick a lady in the face like he can. If only his acting was as good. Watching him try and get through the ending of this movie is painful but entertaining. This is just a great movie to watch for fun. I know its supposed to be serious drama or horror or something but its a great comedy. Enjoy the movie just don't expect to much. It's not about the plot with this movie it's about the weird one liners and "plot twist?".

column4: Crappy Movie That Makes Me Laugh
column5: The Wicker Man to be blunt is crappy. Poor actingboring.AND NOT AT ALL SCARY! My friend Drew and I were cracking up at the poor quality of this movie though. When the ladies wore weird costumes me and Drew were cracking up at the fact they were dressed as birdsbeesand bears!! It was funny.And when the guy was on fire and when the girl and the mother was on fire.(We're cruelwe know) And pretty much till the end of the movie I thought the guy Edward( Nicolas Cage) was on crack. I thought he was a drug addict. He was constantly popping pills in his mouth every 5 minutes! And he got all these weird 'dreams' and visions.Then all the guys in this movie are idiots!!!All they do is workdrinkand 'breed'.Plus the ladies are weird too. They ALL look the same they look possessed and creepy. They all laugh while people die!!And they think men are only useful for 'breeding'.This movie to be blunt againis CRAPPY. I'm surprised Nicolas Cage even did this movie!!! Poor acting and confusing.Don't waste your time.

column4: This movie is Crazy Nutz Physco Weird Stupid Idiotic Dumb Gay Mad Bad Ugly s.o.b !!
column5: This Movie Is AWFUL PLEASE Don't WATCH THIS ......It Makes Me Feel Like Never Watching Movies Again In My Entire LIFE !!!! IT SICKENS ME......This Is The Biggest INSULT TO Hollywood HISTORY !!!! I'D LIKE TO SLAP NICOLAS CAGE IN HIS FACE AND KICK HIS BALLS !!!! Please ban these people from making movies.....And i hope the cast goes straight to HELL for acting in this Ludicrous VULGAR VILE movie !!! Man i should never watch a movie without checking IMDb first !!! IMDb ROCKS !!!! I GIVE THIS SHITTY MOVIE 1 FOR MAKIN ME PUKE AND LOSE MY TASTE FOR MOVIES.....

This is one of those movies that after you watch it you wonder why you did in the first place. The film has virtually no plot when the strings of the movie start to tie together you are questioning WTF the entire time. And then the ending. Dear movie creators please stop making horrible films. I would love to give you spoilers of why this film is bad but to see the true horror that is this crap you have to watch it. Save yourself some money and do not see this film. I like Nic Cage as an actor but he must have been desperate for roles when this was offered. The film is just really really really bad. I can't explain it any better than that.

column4: I Laughed Through the Whole Movie
column5: OK so I heard bad reviews on the movie. Well I didn't hear I read reviews. I am the type of person who goes on my opinion. So I decided to give the movie a chance.Oh my god...that had to be the dumbest movie ever!!! Jeez...my friend and i laughed so hard at the ridiculous events through the whole movie! I agree that was the biggest waste of $9. I like Nicolas cage and Ellen burstyn. That had to be their worst movies out of their whole movie career. I hope it doesn't end their careers. It was horrible. I think they should win "The Worst Movie of the Year" award. I think they have a chance. I know that sounds mean; but its true.

How did it burn being the best and most memorable part of the movie. Cage's character Edward repeatedly screams it without giving Willow (Beahan) a chance to answer. My friends and I laughed and poked fun at it just like several other parts of the movie.I'm prone to seeing bad movies. I saw Napoleon Dynamite. I saw Cold Creek Manor. I saw Lady in the Water (which I found to be not as bad as the reviews claim it is). I'd rank this above Lady in the Water but below CCM and Napoleon on the "Crappy movie" scale.First off let's review some of the hilarity of the movie. Cage's character is apparently a druggie or something because at one point in the movie he took several pills. Those could be for his bee allergy but drugs could easily explain his ridiculously stupid behavior throughout the movie. He sees things constantly (such as the girl that he's searching for getting hit by a truck while he's on a ship) and that would only make sense if he was either a drug addict or was mentally unstable. Another memorable (read: hilarious) part of the movie is where Edward finds the mutilated body of the pilot that was his only way out of here; his eyes ripped out and his mouth sewn shut along with one of his hands missing. Edward immediately begins shaking the corpse as if trying to get him to "wake up." I don't think he's going to wake up now Eddy.And then there's the ending. I didn't see this coming. Nor did I want it to happen. Sure it's a different angle to have the main character sacrificed. It happened in The Skeleton Key (albeit the main character survived in a new body) but this time around he didn't survive. Quite the contrary; the movie draws to a close with Edward's tortured screams echoing across the theater as he burns to death. I don't like it when my protagonist dies. Especially something as horrible as being BURNT.Alright so that's all. It had a confusing but okay plot that had several unintentionally hilarious scenes and a disturbing and disappointing ending. I haven't seen the original Wicker Man and I doubt that the main character lives in that one. So yeah. That's my review.

I would have to agree with the previous statement. I sent an email to everyone I know somewhat of a Public Service Announcement if you will about how unbelievably terrible this movie was.The original Wicker Man was names one of Britain's best movies so how could they have taken this one so far in the opposite direction? Please if you are one of those people who want to see what all the fuss is about even if people say the movie is bad PLEASE STOP. It will raise your blood pressure it's so bad.I too left the theater furious with myself that I let it happen. You leave feeling used taken advantage of...and just plain disappointed. Do NOT...I repeat DO NOT see this movie.

I really got into the movie and was enjoying its trip through it yes it was mildly predictable and it was more suspense thriller than horror but it was an interesting story. I liked it right up to that pitiful excuse for an ending. I never saw the original film but I understand it follows it but I don't get having such a richly developed character as Nicholas Cages was that is honest and only doing what is truly right I actually really LIKED the character only to have it killed at the end no climatic escape/rescue/or even some form of later vengeance. It completely killed it for me had he made it or had gotten some form of vengeance after the fact I would have said this was one of the best movies I had ever seen. This was a production by a major film company with big names and a budget I hate seeing such an "indy" ending to it.

Just terrible. I mean really horrible movie. The sad thing is that before I saw this movie I saw Nicholas Cage in an interview say that he has been waiting his whole career to remake this movie. He said the original was his all time favorite movie. That goes to show you that actors even the great ones might not have such great taste. Let me guess Nicholas your second favorite was Gigli? And your favorite actor of all time was Chris Farley for his dramatic stage presence? (No offense to Chris Farley's family)I think that this movie should have been left at the original. It was not a great movie but had a cult following. Movies like that should be left alone. That would be like Matt Damon and Ben Affleck deciding one day they want to remake Pulp Fiction. Leave it alone. Which is what this director neglected to do. This movie was a mixture of boredom and confusion for me. I could not wait until the end. Maybe I would have been better off not watching the first one. Then maybe that might have helped. On a scale of 1-10 I gave it a 2. Thats the best it deserves.

This movie is so awful that you will come to the conclusion at the end that you should have so not watched it! It is full of suspense and is misleading to everyone at the end believing something else from the actual plot but something really bad happens at the end which spoils the entire movie the director has no clue what so ever about how to keep viewers taste it all ends like a hammer through your head and you come to the conclusion that you should have just watched jerry springer instead....at least you wouldn't be shaking your head still the next day! The thing that is so disappointing is that Nic Cage would play something so horrible...it's something that Kevin Costner would do. Then maybe who ever watched this movie wouldn't hold out hope to the bitter end!

I LIKED the Wicker man. I have not seen the original so I cannot compare the 2; yet despite the lack of publicity that the movie got it was better than I thought. If you like psychological thrillers or movies that you have to be paying attention too then its a fun movie. My best friend and I saw it it's a female empowering movie that lets you put things together and you see a different society at work.The cinematography was beautiful the island alone is gorgeous.Don't watch this movie if you can't take it for what it is entertainment an a bit of a cult movie. I can see this movie becoming a movie that 20 years from now will be compared to Children of the Corn.Nicolas Cage is a cop who is doubting himself when he gets a mysterious letter with no postal mark; he is led to an island where the inhabitents are mostly female and where males are 'seen and not heard.' He finds the woman he was going to marry and finds out that she left when she was carrying his child and that little girl goes missing. He has to find her at ANY cost.

column4: Don't waste your time on this one
column5: This movie does not compare with the original. I could hardly believe how poorly it was written and directed. The actors did a poor job. This is not one of Nicholas Cage's better movies. He should have been embarrassed to be part of the movie and he was one of the producers. There was very little creativity in the movie. There was very little to keep the movie going. I would only recommend watching this movie if it were on TV and you had nothing else to do. I could hardly stand to watch it to the end. Watch the original if you haven't seen it. Even if I had never seen the original I would not have enjoyed this movie and the people who I watched it with agree.

for the record my vote is on talent mostly the acting in this film was unreal and led you to believe the garbage that was being put out front for you to see.. the only reason i cannot rate this movie as a whole is because to me half of the movie is missing. their was no justice in this film what-so-ever. the expectations you had over n.cage's performance was from the setting that was created portraying an ending with just.. yes i understand that the movie does a 360 degree turn near the ending but it should of been even more incentive for that justice to be sought.. and it could of been done easily in my opinion to keep the pace of the film an the original plot at it's best the only thing that would of changed is it's ratings as this film could of been one of the best this year i feel that way too much was over-looked. the movie it's self was great just prepare yourself for a complete let-down and facial expression close to confusion associated with milk frustration before watching this film and you should do fine! once again my vote was on performance "9"

When i saw this movie I have to say it was somewhat intriguing. The plot was nicely done (yes i realize its a remake) comparing to other horror films. I just have to say that this movie simply wasn't scary other than some rather annoying parts that just made loud noises to make you jump out of your seat. The end is quite disturbing also but at the same time left a scary touch. Having said that ill be blunt here. This movie is just plain garbage. The only reason i liked it is because i laughed so hard! There are so many parts that are just random and unnecessary yet funny! I'm not sure if this is good or bad but i really don't think the writers intended this so I'm guessing thats bad. For example Nicholas Cage beats up 2 old ladys and kicks the crap out of a younger lady which does not look good for him although funny. He has about 5 random flashbacks where the girl gets hit by the semi AGAIN (dont worry that happens in the beginning and was even in the preview) and points a gun at a school teacher for her bike... I think I've said enough. Made me laugh a lot so it wasn't too bad but if your looking for scary just watch the original.

The worst movie one can ever watch. A big waste of time I don't know why make a movie as pointless as this. I'd like my time back I felt mislead I watched because it was Nicolas Cage he can't possibly accept and play a stupid movie and so I patiently waited if there was anything of substance and I wondered how is this movie going to redeem itself? After having escaped death many times and in the end he was burnt to death? It was a burning man show after all? What really is the point of this movie? Anybody knows? I watched tons of movies and this is the first time I write a review because it angered me for having lost time and so disappointed.

column4: I have absolutely no opinion on this movie.
column5: I see a lot of movies and always have an opinion on what I see good or bad. Not on this movie. I can't say anything good or bad about it. I didn't think it was a bad movie but it wasn't a good movie either. I give it a 3/10. I consider Mel Gibson's "Passion" to be a 1/10 (or lower) and any senseless gory horror movie a 2/10 (think Saw II).My props to Nick Cage for taking on a role that could potentially end his career. But I doubt enough people will see this movie to care anyways. He luckily redeemed himself with an excellent role in the 9/11 movie which was released around the same time.I still recommend seeing this but only out of morbid curiosity.

This was probably the most disappointing movie I have seen in a very long time. The best parts of the movie were shown in the trailer. There wasn't much suspense or drama to speak of. The most serious parts of the film (flashbacks etc) were met with laughter throughout the theater. No one took this story in a serious tone in which the director meant it to be taken. In a time where it looks as though Nic Cage was coming into his own he takes on a role that does nothing for him possible damaging his connection with fans. Although the effort was admirable the plot was silly and the acting sub par. Good try....but I wouldn't even recommend this feature as a weekend rental unless you enjoy "B" movies and acting. A good waste of $14 and sad end to a good date....very disappointing.

If you go in without expectations or expect very little you will not be disappointed. The movie is advertised as a thriller but in fact I found it to be absolutely hilarious. I really wondered whether the comedy was intentional because it was just so blatant. Cage's cheesy lines and delivery (this could be said for most of the actors actually) provided a number of laugh out loud moments. Especially memorable was the scene at the end when Cage keeps getting shot (or beaten...hard to say because he's off screen) and with each shot he keeps yelling out something new - totally reminiscent of Austin Powers when one of the guys goes down the shaft and yells out "I'm not quite dead yet" with each new blow. Once Cage started yelling out "BITCHES" I was nearly in tears. Haven't seen the original so I can't say anything about how the remake compares but I would almost recommend this movie for the sheer comedic value.

Works better as a comedy the last 20 minutes were absolutely hilarious as Cage starts knocking out women and attempted very bad karate kicks. I only give this movie a 3 because the cinematography and music are very good. The music is done by David Lynch's usual composer Angelo Badalamenti and is way better then the movie deserves. The movie is not remotely scary and you can spot the trick ending in the first 20 minutes. The acting by Cage was as bad a Tom Hanks in DaVinci Code. Two usually good actors who forgot how to act how strange. Ellen Burstyn is wasted as well as Lelee Sobieski two actresses I usually enjoy immenselyI'm really getting sick of remakes of horror movies. Hopefully Cage can redeem himself with Ghostrider.

column4: We don't have to sacrifice the original to enjoy the remake!
column5: No one likes to hold an unpopular opinion. As a species we enjoy the acceptance that comes goes along with confirming to popular opinion. Never the less here goes...I really liked the Wicker Man remake. There I said it. Let's make a few things clear to begin with: I'm not a fan of remakes of classic films nor am I fond of Nicholas Cage as an actor. Also I don't think that anyone would argue that the original Wicker Man is not a colossus of British film making. It is indeed an excellent film and one of my personal favourites.So let's imagine for a moment that this film isn't a remake at all try to divorce it in our minds from the original what do we have left? The answer is a handsome and well made film that stands in its own right. Nicholas Cage spends every moment of his screen time mercilessly chewing on the scenery in the special way that only he can. The film moves along at a swift pace trasporting the viewer from one twist to another. The cinematography is beautiful and the supporting cast are a talented bunch who do a fine job of hoodwinking Cage at every turn and inviting the viewer to sympathise with the world that they live in.OK we didn't need a remake. Everyone can agree on that. The plot makes no sense at all: what exactly is the religion of these people? Where did it come from? None of this is ever explored because of course the plot's logic is tissue paper thin and would instantly evaporate with the slightest poke of enquiry applied to it. Yet despite myself I couldn't help but love it. I was engaged and entertained. And honestly at the very least  what else can we expect from any film? So let's forget that it's a butchering of a beloved classic and enjoy it as a film in it's own right. If you're looking of an enjoyable piece of nonsense escapism you could do a lot worse.
Suspense and thrilling scared me and that is rare for a movie...in top 10 of scariest movies I have seen; maybe because it isn't all that far fetched.

The only thing worse than the slow pace of this movie is the utterly unsatisfying ending if you can call it an ending.Reading the reviews of the original I am not glad I had not seen the original until after because I may have left the theater screaming.While it's very beautifully shot I was very disappointed with Cage's performance he seemed very out of his element and clearly frustrated.About halfway through the movie my wife turned to me and commented how slow it was. Then a few minute later she feigned interested after commenting: their drones.Unfortunately she too was frustrated at the stereotypical ending.What I have learned is to check the reviews here before attending a movie.

This movie cannot be taken seriously in order to enjoy it. I think i saw it in theaters and spent the whole time bawling from laughter. It was so bad it made laugh so hard. I am a female and in no way support domestic violence but the fact that whoever made this movie thought it was okay for Mr. Cage to brawl with females was so messed up one can't help but laugh. There are lots of bad movies people guiltily admit to liking and this is one of them for me. Surprisingly I know other people that completely agree with me and laughed throughout the whole movie. Don't go out of your way to see this but if it's one and you feel like laughing at something awful this is it.

column4: Not as bad as reviews claim... Leave 1* for worse..
column5: 2006 The Wicker Man has appeared on so many lists as one of the worst movies ever produced so my curiosity got the better of me. I have seen atrocious movies deliberately looking for the worst for acting storyline experience the whole 9...
