After seeing so many great movies I found it just as much enjoyable to watch the worst its as entertaining to me.. And after watching this movie I was disappointed.....it was not so bad! Too many reviewers overuse 1 for dissatisfaction apparently they haven't seen a really bad movie... Yeah Cage's acting is not worth an Oscar but not bad; storyline suspense scenes picture cast and music is good and enjoyable.. 1* out of 10 should be left for much worse and the list is huge..

There is a synopsis of "Wicker Man 2" in Sky Movie Mag for July referring amongst other things to "a matriarchal society of beekeepers" which made me sit up and think. Wasn't there a film made in 1944 with Arthur Askey of all people called "Bees in Paradise". Older viewers will remember Arthur Askey on radio in the 30's with Band Waggon and his big film "The Ghost Train". The idea of a connection between Arthur Askey and "Wicker Man" is a bit surrealistic but does it mean that the producers of the current film have pinched the story from "Bees in Paradise" and the title from "Wicker Man 1"? By the way according to your records both BIP and WM2 had the most appalling reviews.

Wow. It's the day after seeing this movie and I am still feeling a bit icky. This movie was pretty disappointing. The story had so many holes and unanswered questions that it makes me want to say "Don't waste your money." First what was the deal with the car wreck at the beginning? Was it staged only to give Nicolas Cage's character enough time off to be able to go to Summersisle? If so that is a very disappointing thing. Secondly Nicolas Cage being a police officer is very unrealistic. He doesn't press for important answers that the audience wants to know. For example "Why don't the men talk?" "What DO you women do when a baby boy is born?" "Why do you let the children torture animals?" "What is the deal with the sex ed so early?" etc. *sigh* Then there were the scenes that were obviously just thrown in to make the movie longer. For example the whole thing at the beginning with the self-help tapes. What the heck was that about? And what about the little thing about Nicolas Cage's character being allergic to bees? That leads to another question: "What exactly is the OLD WAY in which she cured him?" Overall we walked out of this movie going "I wasted two hours of what little time I have on earth for that?"

I'm about to spoil a good portion of this film. I feel it is necessary because occasionally harsh derision of a movie can actually coax a viewer into wanting to watch it even more. I would like to save you some time. This movie is a travesty- start to finish.For starters the opening sequence is entirely unrelated to the rest of the movie. Perhaps it ties in a metaphorical way but nevertheless you will spend an hour and a half wondering what happened in the crash and what consequences it will have and the answer is NONE. It has no effect on Cage's character and it is entirely without closure throughout the rest of the movie. Ridiculous.The movie attempts to be clever by throwing a complete plot switch-up in at the end but it is very much unfounded and just cruel not ironic. There is no buildup or basis to it and it actually creates a lot of confusion and contradiction to previous parts of the film. It's just unnecessary and the extraordinarily violent acts performed on Cage could easily have been quite cathartic if performed on ANY SINGLE OTHER CHARACTER IN THE FILM but as it stands it's just mean and depressing.The film is nonsensical tripe. It is the arthritic skeleton of a snuff film draped in the rancid meat of a psychological thriller. Regardless of metaphors and allegory it stands in the realm of continuity and logic as a shambling flaming golem of crap. Without question skip this horrible film. Please.

This movie deserved at least one point for the unintended humor in watching Nicholas Cage (in all his manic glory) bumble around an island of tight lipped women trying to crack the secret of his ex-fiancé's missing daughter (or could it be...wait for it...his daughter!!??) to no resolution eventually succumbing to punching women repeatedly in the face and screaming "bitches!" at the top of his lungs. All I know is that my friend Dave and I went into this movie hoping for a scare and came out of it giddy with laughter. Not a good sign for a horror movie but an enjoyable experience nonetheless. I highly recommend this movie for anyone who's slightly inebriated and wants to laugh at an astronomically bad movie that takes itself too seriously. Enjoy!

I ticked this as a spoiler although i believe it would not be possible to spoil the ending of this movie any more than the film makers did.There was some good bits in it some tense moments even. but the film stopped just as it was getting interesting and left me waiting for an ending. a proper ending. To STOP the movie at the point where all along you knew it would end as soon as Nick Cage starts poking around leaves the viewer feeling cheated.I saw it coming that the main character had been lured there to be sacrificed as it seems many have before but i HOPED (foolishly) that we were following this particular occurrence because this one was different in some way. Justice perhaps is dealt or he gets away despite the odds. BUT NO! samey samey the bad guys win the good guy dies for nothing. The real loser is you the poor unsuspecting audience.I usually like Nick Cage movies just cos he is in em but the ending of this is so unbelievably poor even his presence isn't enough. Just a little more effort from the makers and this could have been a good film.I watch films for entertainment not to be angered by the blatant disrespect of the movie goer by whoever is responsible for the ending to this... WHAT WERE THEY THINKING?!?!?!?!? should be ashamed. I wish there was minus ratings available.

column4: Even Cage couldn't drag this story more out! Don't see it
column5: See another movie the bad acting made the story just awful go rent The Skeleton Key instead. If you think off Cage you think off Face/Off The Rock and The Weather Man each of those movies starring an excellent Nicholas Cage. In this movie Cage is letting us down by starring in a cheap predictable now good (horror) story and like I said before even the skeleton key had better twists and most off you know that this isn't a compliment. The whole society of the isle had just too many characteristics of 'The Village' living in a strange peaceful community just let people know that there's something wrong about itplease face it and stay away from the classics!!!

I don't think I have ever laughed this much in my life. Nicholas Cage was appalling. Surprise Surprise. God Bless him He tries. Me and my friends made the mistake of choosing this film to watch to 'scare us' we ended up absolutely wetting ourselves. There was too many loose ends left unanswered. For example the beginning image of the car crash had no clear relevance to the film. Was it a dream? Or a flash back? and if so who were the people in the car? Can anyone explain this as the film didn't. The little girl in the car and Rowan looked very similar which was very very very confusing. If they were the same little girl then it makes no sense as Nicholas Cages character had no knowledge that the child was his until he reached the island. And why did he dress up as bear? And why did he leave the bear feet on? It was all so confusing. It makes my head spin. I wasn't all awful the strangeness of the villagers on the island was conveyed very well. If you fancy a laugh then I'd recommend it to anyone. Otherwise I'd give it a miss.

OK this isn't anywhere near as good as the original but come on people don't bash it. it's just a movie and it was an OK way for me to spend a day. if you are the hardest hard core fan of the original don't see this remake it's nothing new or even close to the original besides obvious plot parts.It wasn't Oscar worthy but what horror movie is these days? My final word is THEY TRIED!(3) out of (5)The Wicker Man is rated PG-13 for disturbing images and violencePerformance (3) Actors (2) Story (3) (for not being very original anymore)

column4: The Wicker Man will make you sicker man. Avoid it!
column5: I too assumed with Nicolas Cage and an intriguing trailer that this movie would be a sure-fire fear fest.Erroneous!The acting is crap at best. The characters are one-dimensional which makes the fact that they are poorly developed even more noticeable. And all of this mediocrity is showcased by a predictable lackluster screenplay. The editing's poor the directing's lame and the entire product sets feminism back by about 250 years.The only redeeming quality about the movie is the Pacific Northwest scenery. But you're better off spending two hours watching Frasier reruns and looking up tips from the Washington State Department of Tourism.

this film was an utter disaster... before you read on i would like to point out the fact that i have never written a comment on a film ever... but this film was just so bad i felt it my duty to let people know what i though ..... Nicholas cage i must say was one of the very few reasons i opted to watch the film... however he is one of the MANY reasons i opted to begin cleaning up my room while the sound of cage screaming as he went up in flames made me smile and say to myself .... thank god this BS is almost over.... Nicholas cage was awful .... he pulled out a gun and pointed it at a woman who later is dressed in a bird costume ( dude the costumes were so Disney ) and screamed step away from the bike.... i cried with laughter for the next ten minutes..... honestly what a load of BS... there were so many pointless parts to the plot ... i mean honestly what was with the scene about the car going up in flames i mean honestly and the bees.... had not one thing to do with the final climax.... of cage being burned to a crisp....I'm not going to tell you not to watch the film ...by all mean watch it and you are sure in for a laugh .... and let the kids watch as well.... the scene where there are waif blonde's 50 yr old fat women and 5 yr old possessed children dressed in freakishly funny animal costumes will keep them laughing too.....

column4: Waste of Time Waste of Money...
column5: Being a fan of Nick Cage I have to say I'm utterly disappointed in the outcome of this movie. The writers of this script (if it can be called that) is so far from the original that I could hardly bear to watch.I'm pretty sure Nick did the best he could under the circumstances but with writers and directors of this magnitude of stupidity it's understandable that the entire movie was sub-par.If I had to sum up the movie in a few short words I'd tell you that I'd be reluctant to use their so called "script" as secondary toilet paper.Waste your time if you'd like but don't be surprised when you walk away saying "What the hell was that?"

WORST film i have ever seen. Scariest thing was a crow flying out of a crest :/ after 30 minutes of the film me and my friend slowly started to get brainwashed by the dullness of the film. After 45 we started laughing because it was so meaningless and poor it started getting hilarious especially at the part where the detective started to randomly knock out women. After fully watching the film we felt that we lost a good amount of time and an even bigger amount of brain cells that were destroyed completely by this awful film.... Even the very good acting of Nicolas Cage couldn't help get this film any better. I hardly imagine how could one make it worse....

column4: So terrible I can't think of a witty title
column5: This movie put the "bad" in bad. I registered on IMDb just to write about how terrible it is. A more suitable title for Wicker Man would be "Avoiding Questions" because that is what each character in this movie does quite successfully. Below is an actual little snippet of conversation which represents the main character's ineptness at getting answers.Edward Malus: "And what if someone just happens to have a boy what do you do then?" Sister Summers Isle: "That depends." {walks off screen} Edward Mauls: "Let me ask you one other thing because frankly I just don't get you I don't get this place." Sister Summers Isle: "Oh you will. In time perhaps." {Condescendingly; with an added dash of foreshadow}The ending sequence in this movie caused me the most pain. The entire plot is ruined over the missing bullet device. In a sense I was not surprised by this because had the gun been fully functional Edward could have jumped forward and grabbed someone (the Matriarch would be a good choice as no sister would risk losing her) to use as a hostage walked all the way down to the dock and rowed that little boat to safety. This would have ruined the fun of the people devising the plot.I was however surprised to see the gun not work because at no point does he leave it unguarded. When he wakes up from the bee stings he specifically checks it and the bullets are plainly visible. When he swims in the hole it doesn't show him take the gun off but even if he took it off and left it by the hatch he swims directly to the surface when he hears the hatch slam shut and proceeds to wait by there all night. Even if Willow did steal the bullets a large part of a gun's total weight comes from its ammo content(lead: denser than steel). He would have known the moment he picked it up that something was more amiss than just a cohesive script and plausible literary devices.I could stop here so I will. The reason I gave this a "2" was for the actual production. I thought the lighting was well done because I barely even noticed it. Sound design was only shabby during flashbacks and when the Edward was "hearing things." In fact I feel bad for the technical crew because they put in so much hard work and I assume had very little creative license over the script.

column4: I am sickened by this trash.
column5: No wonder we are faced with global warming! This stinker called a movie may be the worst film I have ever invested time watching. If I were a producer I would not give a dime to any of these people writers directors actors etc. I knew from a few years ago that there was some interest in this film and it sounded on some level to be interesting. So when I saw it was on TV this morning I decided to tune in. This is very disturbing flick. Shame on Cage for doing it. It proves that my dislike for Ellen Burstyn is completely justified and she is a sick woman with no redeeming qualities. This film can do more psychological damage than Blue Velvet. Please do not watch this piece of junk ever!

This version wasn't nearly as good as the original and I'm not even British! Not enough information was given to the viewer about the ritualistic history of the island. Nicolas Cage seemed almost bored for pretty much the whole time. There were far too many holes in the plot. Not a whole lot made any sense during the movie and questions the viewer had were never really answered by the end. At least in the original everything was laid out-ducks all in a row- and by the time the magnificent horrific finale came it was all realized and wonderful. Tied up with a pretty ribbon finished. I didn't like the fact that the old blind twins mentioned the wicker man in the beginning of the movie. And in the schoolhouse was a cage with a miniature wicker man hanging inside of it. It was better in the original when the wicker man was revealed at the very end without any fore-knowledge. I nearly freaked out when i saw there was an epilogue. AN EPILOGUE!!! For heaven's sake they could have done without it. However I did like the fact that in the police station there was a poster (missing person possibly?) with the wonderful Edward Woodward's face on it!! And the fact that Cage's character was named Edward and Rowan's last name had been changed from Morrison(in the original) to Woodward. Teehee. Kudos to that!

column4: Piece of garbage! I want my time and money back after seeing this horrible movie!
column5: I want my time and money back after seeing this movie!. Don't waste your time watching this horrible poor taste no sense idiotic sadistic piece of garbage!. Besides that is horrible I am so upset after seeing it that I can't even articulate myself because is so horrible. Do yourself a favor and don't see this useless piece of garbage there are real movies that you can watch and are worth time and effort this one is not one of those. Without revealing the plot all I can say is that this is another let-down movie. The only emotions I have after seeing it are frustration and lots of anger and not for good reasons just for time and money lost. I thought it would be a mystery type paranormal thing what a disappointment! is just a fiasco with very bad taste. Please take in consideration this comment and save your time money and also these feelings.

column4: Nicholas Cage stuck on an island with no way out.
column5: I must say that this is the worst movie I have ever seen in my life. Don't get me wrong Nicholas Cage can be good in some movies but in this movie he was just terrible. I don't even know if the movie was bad because of him but he sure contributed to it. The movie was an hour and a half of garbage and it really had no point to it. It took me about the first hour and fifteen minutes to even get a jist of what was going on in the movie. If you want to see this movie i strongly recommend seeing the 1973 version as i am sure it is much better than the 2006 version. Generally original versions of movies are much better than the remakes such as the omen Halloween and psycho. If you want to see this movie or a movie like it i would recommend seeing the ring and the village. If you see both of these movies you will get the full effect of the Wicker Man except 100x better.

This movie is nowhere near as bad as people are posting. There are several scenes that are pretty funny that are not supposed to be. For example Nicolas Cage running around in the bushes in a bear suit! Also the constant slapping himself in the face from bee attacks. The movie's filming locations were great! They were filmed on the coast of British Columbia Canada. The story had some suspense but was not scary. The story centers on Nicolas Cage's character trying to find a little girl on an isolated island. On this Island lives a religious cult made up of mostly women. He must find out if she has been murdered or if she is being held captive somewhere on the island. The story moves along quickly and was mildly entertaining. I would not have paid money to watch it in the movie theater but it is definitely worth renting. I would give it a strong 5 out of 10!

Honestly at the start of the movie i was getting into the movie; but when he started yelling at kids and calling them all "little liars" i started to laugh. I thought it was just a one time funny thing; how wrong was I. After that part the movie just turned into a mistaken comedy and keep in mind this was only like 25 min into an 110min movie. Pretty much Cage goes on a god dam rampage pointing guns at unarmed women jacking some womens bike riding the bike looking like Mr.bean. And the top it all off near the end of the movie when he realizes his kid is still alive and is gonna be sacrificed he walks down stairs into the tavern and really and i mean really clocks this women named sister BEECH. Honestly sound that out just say it out loud what does that does like so you son of a beech. The whole movie you hear this name and you can't help but laugh abit. Anyways after he punches sister Beech in the face and TKOs her another girl comes in and jumps on his back he then flips her over and punches and kicks her right into a wall. It's funny cause they look like milk maids. Then takes sister beeches bear suit to get his kid back at this sacrificial festival (they are going to burn her alive because they believe she cursed their crops)all these people have stupid ass costumes too really funny to see. Cages kid is tied up to a pole and everybody is standing far back and all you see is this guy running in a bear suit towards this kid. Then after that he finds up he has bin set up and he turns out to be the one that they want to sacrifice. So as they capture him he says" Killing me won't bring back your god dam honey" and then (Snap)"MY LEGS" really funny you have to watch it. Basically if you want to go see a thriller don't see this movie nobody can take it seriously but if you wanna see comedy well then my friend you can to see this movie cause nothing fits right with it.

All in all a rather mediocre remake of the super-campy 70s movie of the same name. Much as I wanted to enjoy this film as I had the original I can't help but feel that the movie would have benefited enormously from more camp more tripped-out hippy nonsense and a little less earnestness.I was pleased that Mr. LaBute was so reverential of the source material but without the over-the-top campiness of the original this movie feels very vanilla.I'd like to judge this film on its own merits without reference to the original but to do so would be even less favourable. The plot is silly nonsensical and labyrinthine; Mr. LaBute employs shock techniques which a ten year old could see coming; and the final scene lacks punch. This is doubly so because the explanation of the importance of the Malus character is so trite lacking the poetic quality of the original.I must give credit for casting though especially Ms. Burstyn who has a pleasantly commanding presence in conversation with Mr. Cage. In spite of the fact that the social structure of the community is left somewhat undefined (something that might have been very interesting to pursue further) it is clear that Sister Summersisle belongs in charge.In short this film lacks all the things that made the original entertaining or frightening while retaining all that made the original so bad.

When I first saw the advertisements for the remake of "The Wicker Man" I was very excited about seeing this movie especially with the involvement of "A" list talent. I remember finding this gem of a horror movie in my local video store sometime in the early 80's and being very impressed by it. My only complaint was the folk music soundtrack that took away some of the suspense but the plotting took me completely by surprise with the nature of the true sacrifice.Updating the story to a "Amazon Pagan Colony" is obviously in hindsight not necessary. I can only imagine in screenplay form this seemed to be a good idea that fell flat on its face on screen.I find it hard to judge a remake when I know and love the original but there was just no "atmosphere" in this weird tale. To the filmmakers thanks for trying but it just doesn't improve or update the original.

This film Stared off good. And by good I mean great! You have a depressed Police officer Edward Malus who has just seen a tragic incident he cannot get out of his mind. When he gets a letter from his ex his life begins spiraling out of control. His ex's daughter is missing and he sets off to find her. Through twisted lies disturbing rituals And a horrific island cult He is determined to find this little girl. Its entertaining and interesting for about the first hour and 10 minutes so most of the film. But the ending is one of the absolute worst endings I've EVER seen. It is disturbing It is sickening its flat out terrible! I am not going to spoil it as it is a unpleasant twist. But I will say forget the ending You will like the movie. Good movie Terrible ending. But I still recommend seeing it if you like good suspense flicks or dramas just see past the ending. Either way hope this helps! Kris

I actually spent 3 hours on a crappy movie this morning. First watching it for 2 hours then register me here for 1 hour just tell you all out there that this was the worst movie ever. The movie starts really good in it have the feeling you get from "the others" with Kidman but later on it feels more like a episode of "Lost". Not enough fantasy to finish the movie and way to complicated to end the movie properly. Nicholas Cage sold out pretty bad this time. So if you don't like crappy movies save your money and buy an ice cream or something cause it will make you happier afterward.Remember me saying this is the worst movie ever i have seen "crossroads" with Spears.

column4: Good for a laugh go to a matinée
column5: A couple of things: Malus is Latin for "apple" or crabapple anyway. Possible link to original film's apple orchards.The bf and I recognized the score as being a fairly blatant rip-off of the soundtrack from "Messiah of Evil" another "horror" film that was more comedic than spooky.Nic Cage is known for weird performances but this one was freakish. His lisp has never been as noticeable and his speech patterns were almost Jimmy Stewart-esquire. "Ah musht be ladiessh night." His stumbling drugged aspect after emerging from Ellen Burstyn's lovely house was amusing (as was Willow's through-out the film. Her lips were maybe supposed to be bee-stung but I think they overdid it. It was quite distracting.) His frequent outbursts and screaming fits ("GodDAMNit!" just what I always scream after an annoying double hallucination) only added to the laffs. The pill-popping too. A tour de force all around.I like the unexplained: twins the egg symbol on the school house door why women would keep men with no useful tongues around why Nic kept checking his stupid cell phone. The dripping burlap sack must have been intended as a flash-forward to the end. I'm glad the girls from the car crash and the lady cop showed up on the island as I'd been wondering why they'd been in the film at all.Could the epilogue mean we can look forward to a sequel? Oh boy! We can hardly wait for more LaBute anti-Mormon symbolism. I could have done without all the "Don't Look Now" rip-offs and idiotic nocturnal crypt-swimming and just jumped right to the fisticuffs and bear-suit shenanigans: top quality.My fave: "Aaahhh! Killing me ishn't going to bring back your goddam honey! Aaahhhh! Aaaahhh! My legsh!"

I rarely am moved enough by a movie to bother writing my thoughts down to share with others. This movie did so. Not because it was a grand cinematic masterpiece. No sadly there are no masterpieces to be found here. To put it mildly this movie was AWFUL.My mother went with me to see it which is strange because she said she had seen the original and afterwords stated this one was just like it. Why on earth did she agree to see it again? A better question may be "Why on earth did Hollywood MAKE it again?" There are so many great screenplays out there that get passed over for this rubbish.I have never in my life demanded my money back after watching a movie. But I surely would have had I not won the tickets to this one off the radio.To sum it up. This was a waste of 2 hours of my life. Also a waste of all the hours that the actors and crew put in and all the money spent making it/promoting it.Such a waste.

column4: an okay film another fantastic performance from Nicolas cage
column5: the wicker man is about a man(Edward) who goes to an island to help his ex fiancé find her daughter. however when he gets to the island he finds that it is an odd place. The people are odd the place is odd and their "ritual" is odd. Edward soon realises the people on the island are going to sacrifice his ex fiancés daughter(who also turns out to be his daughter) and he tries to stop them. when he does rescue his daughter he tries to get her away but she leads him back to where the ritual is because it turns out it was him they were planning on sacrificing all along.His ex fiancé betrayed him and basically led him to his death.

column4: Come for the film stay for the Cage
column5: As previously mentioned this film is no 'tunnel' film that is the audience can easily spot the ending after the penultimate minutes this of course was a re-make perhaps the saddest thing about the whole film. It was in fact a pretty mediocre film in 1974 and it is more so in 2006. The original a British production and starring Edward Woodward as the local 'bobby' on a small Island of the coast of Cornwall (South-West England UK).So essentially this Americianized version really doesn't go any further than the original a sad fact that is the only haunting element of this film.However if you still want to see this film in you 'Doubting Thomas' fashion Nicolas Cage would be the only reason that you will stay beyond the initial moments of this still mediocre film.

column4: All I can Say is Nicholas Cage in a Bear Suit.
column5: On an IMDb scale this movie should be close to a .125. For entertainment value however I highly recommend this movie for a good laugh. The plot reminds me a lot of a show like Lost or a movie twist like the Usual Suspects only not good.Whoever wrote the screenplay for this remake must at some point during the writing process have asked themselves "what the hell I am writing down?" Movies like these give me hope that I can get my screenplay or pretty much any screenplay made into a feature film with wide release.Somewhere somehow this remake got the green light to go into production. The reason why that happened should have been made into a movie in place of The Wicker Man.

That was possibly the worst ending of any movie I have ever seen! I mean you really shouldn't kill of the main character at the end unless there is really a reason to. It kind of makes the movie depressing. Especially if the movie is as bad as it was. I really think that they needed to do a bit more with it. However I liked how they added the cameos at the end with James Franco and Jason Ritter. Jason Ritter was excellent in Joan of Arcadia so I was kind of excited to see him in this. I also agree with many other commenters on Nicolas Cage's violence toward woman. What ever happened to "girls can hit guys but guys can't hit girls?"

First off why the hell was this dedicated to Johnny Ramone. I'm sure one of the late great fathers of punk deserves better.... other than that the casting was nice. I am sorry to say though that I felt the best performance was of James Franco at the end (he was on screen for maybe 3 minutes....) he actually looked drunk then again he may have been working on this movie. Another large problem with this film was that most horror classics at least pretend to have SOME morality. Nic cage does nothing wrong yet is killed horrifically not to mention it sticks of biggotry towards paganism as well bees for some odd reason all in all the plot was loose the script sub-parr cenimatography asthetically unpleasing and movie all around confusing

I found it unintentionally funny. As I must add at least ten lines of text I guess I must expound on why I found it so. Cage's deadpan delivery had me laughing. The actual lines he had to say at times were hilarious. Anytime I see a bear suit in actual use it's funny.What spoilers? The only people that would watch this are those that had seen the first WickerMan and already know what's going to happen. I can't imagine anyone else taking the time to look at it besides to point and mock.It's like a small town Renaissance festival gone awry. I guess you can add to the experience by gnawing on one of those inappropriate and greasy turkey legs.

column4: This movie is a disgrace to my religion!
column5: I myself am pagan i just finished watching "The Wicker Man" and found it at most a disgrace to my religion. The religion portrayed here is satanic and cruel. Pagan is a religion based on balance and peace not killing some innocent man and goats just because your crops failed.According to the Pagan Reed (our bible) "An it harm none do what ye will". In this movie they harm and kill a character to get what they want. According to the pagan balance if that were real life they not only are worshiping the devil (NOT Goddess) by harming someone but they would get it back three fold. For Murder I don't even want to think about would happen to them.Also if the director or and associate ever reads this: toward the end where they chant "The Crone must die". Get your facts straight! If the crone had to die it would be "Sister Summersile not the man. The Crone is the wise one also known as a grandmother. Next time you make a movie pertaining to this particular religion. Research what your doing because I can guarantee you've angered not only me but other pagan's as well. After watching this movie I can only hope my friends (whom are not of the pagan faith) don't think this is what my religion is really about.

I would love to be more positive but found this to be tedious in spite of some good performances. Ellen Burstyn was wonderful as always. Nicolas Cage was likable and quite good in spite of the fact that I'm not a fan. The actress who portrayed Willow was visually distracting- she has such strong features that all I could do was stare at her lips anytime she was on screen- and not in a good way. She was also weak as an actress in my opinion. Her overall presence detracted from the film.They did succeed in building a subtly creepy mood and the film was visually interesting. I would have enjoyed a little more fleshing out of the characters the island history the few males present and their reason for being permitted etc...Overall this film fell short of my expectations (which weren't high to begin with) and could have been so much more interesting but instead just felt badly paced and a an inferior remake overall.

Two hours I can never get back!!!! What a waste of time. The movie is awful the acting is awful every single person in the theater (and there were about 50 at the 7pm showing we saw) was disappointed. I didn't hear one positive comment other than "thank goodness that's over!" Normally I would suggest waiting for the DVD or TV release...don't even bother with that! Nicolas Cage shows up but that's about all I can say for him in this role. Ellen Burstyn's character is too weird to be even marginally believable. The best part of the whole movie was Kate Beahan. She is absolutely beautiful and I can't remember having seen her in anything else but look forward to more of her.

It was interesting when it started. thats all i really have to say.too bad the end didn't turn out that way though. In my opinion it was just a poor attempt at a remake. (didnt see the other one though)i wouldn't say it was horrible because i got pretty into it but it was bordering it. Too much comical actions by the main character for a so called scary movie.i just don't recommend it. They could have done much better on the ending and all as well.Go see this movie if you want but I'm telling you save your money and see saw 3 in October my friends.

The new wicker man is probably the worst and most disappointing remake in the history of the film making.not only have GOOD English actors been replaced with smarmy American fake actors a English isle has been swapped for Washington!The storyline makes it a certain let down changing most of the original story in dramatic places. As well as the names changing! Rowan morrisons name to Rowan Woodward????? originally Edwards second name! The attempting Hollywood mix of genres that try to come across in the film makes it ridiculous and more corny than anything else. With its pathetic attempts to frighten and to thrill it makes you more curious as to why somebody even bothered to writeproduce and make this remake. The main themes of the original film Paganism and conflict of religion with Edwards strict Christian lifestyle isn't even explored in this remake. I think Hollywood better start coming up with some original stories instead of stealing everybody Else's and making a horrendous job of it.Quite frankly this money could have been put to better use and i could have made a better remake myself with two pieces of plasticine and a few twigs.

column4: Nick Cage fans might like it - otherwise save your time and money and pass on it
column5: Nick Cage stars in this remake of the original of the same name. If you have seen the original then you know what to expect. Cage is your average everyday Joe who is a cop. Due to a on the job occurrence he goes on leave of his job as a cop and takes medication for depression. This "occurance" haunts him throughout the movie and is relived again and again through nightmares and "daydreams". This may be confusing to some viewers. Along the way he is asked to come to an isolated island to search for his ex fiancé's daughter. The people and events he sees on this island are very strange and he sees just how strange as the movie progresses to a shocking and unexpected finale (again for those that have not seen the original). This movie can't really be called a horror flick because it actually doesn't cross into very gory horror territory although death and blood are viewed in certain parts of the film. It is rather disturbing at parts though and it ends up giving a very disappointing and disturbing ending to a movie that has you thinking that the good old Hollywood happy ending would win out in the end as it does in most films. If you love feel good happy endings then this movie is NOT for you. Nick Cage was great as would be expected of an Academy Award winner but the rest of the cast all had small parts that all combined to present the feeling of this big community but separately the acting really was average for the rest of the cast. The replay value is very low on this film. This is not a movie that you will want to watch over and over. In fact once will most certainly be enough for you. Not one of the greatest movies I have seen and it is certainly one of Nick Cage's most dismal and dark films. A score of 4 for the acting of Cage. Without him this movie would have been a complete waste with him it is only a partial waste of time and money. If you do not like Cage then this is a movie you will probably want to pass on.

column4: Like the first one wasn't bad enough?
column5: Could film makers be any more inaccurate about Scottish history and culture? Wicker Man plot is complete garbage. The roman Greek and English propaganda of human sacrifice and barbarianism among their conquests have long been tossed aside by scholars. Do we really need a remake with Nicolas Cage breeding more prejudice? Oh well the wicker man prop was truly cool. We didn't expect much from a horror novel anyway. Now we have Braveheart. Mel Gibson is just an idiot. Not only did he have his stories and characters all wrong but the costuming and weapons covered several eras at once. Nobody wore woad to fight in those times. French princesses were butt ugly in all the illustrations I've seen! The casting was terrible but at least the wild Gaelic hair looked real. The whole "freedom" thing was inspiring the natural scenery was breath-taking and they get points for filming in the rain. Rob Roy was probably the closest but still not an exceptionally realistic depiction.

Some things were ridiculous and so many elements were unexplained and made no sense.The story was great though. How often do you get to see a man be good and women be evil? Granted we might see an evil guy punch a woman in the face but I don't know if I have ever seen a good guy kick an evil woman's ass. It is about time. I don't ever remember seeing a man punch a woman and cheering rather than cringing.These women were truly evil and I think it is a taboo to show an entire female culture as truly evil even though that does not reflect real life. It is especially taboo to create a single white American male character who fights that evil. It was so cool to see when he started to uncover the evil plot and the possible murder of babies that he would get in their face and confront them and even hit them if necessary. They seemed intimidated. Very rare in Hollywood.male = good? female = evil?Very rare indeed.Was the evil doctor aborting/sacrificing male babies? Why were all those babies in jars in the lab?It's somewhat of a break through for the anti-misandry crowd and those of us who notice the real double standards in the industry.It gets points for being politically incorrect.

I can't believe Nicholes Cage and Leelee Sorborsky would take a roll like this. Nicholes Cage has made tons of great movies and to see him in this role was upsetting and for Leelee She took on a small role where no acting was required what a shame shes very enjoyable to watch. This Movie is Boring with a stupid plot!! There was no horror to be scared by.There wasn't even no suspense that caught my attention. There was no good acting that could be enjoyed.If I had paid to see this movie I would have been Angry. Only positive thing that can come from this movie is if you have a problem sleeping at night just put on this movie and you'll sleep like a baby!!

column4: The worst movie I have ever watched.
column5: Rented this in blockbuster back in the day and i actually demanded my money back. I will never get those minutes back in my life. A major reason why I have only seen 1 cage movie since. It left me agitated. In the same way Skylar White from breaking bad can make one feel.

column4: Please do not waste your time on this movie
column5: If you were hoping this movie would be a thriller don't waste your time. The movie is extremely uneventful and ambiguous that keeps building itself up towards the worst ending for a movie I have ever seen. I feel cheated I would rather have spent the past two hours seeing how much of my wall I could paint red by beating my face against it. The previews didn't look all that bad but they DO NOT reflect the quality of the movie. Every few minutes I had to convince myself to keep watching telling myself that somehow they could save the film. I cannot see how anyone would be entertained by this movie now I need to go drink until I cannot remember that horrible ****ing movie.

column4: Good Movie but lots of goofs
column5: I thought it was quite an odd movie but I thought it was a good movie too. In every scene Nicholas Cage's character would have his gun on his hip cut to the next scene and it's gone!!!!! That goes on through out the entire movie! It really annoyed me! I didn't enjoy him having those "visions" either. That scared me. I was very surprised at the ending.... I thought I knew what was going to happen and then at the end....WHAM!!!! What a shocker!!! Nicholas Cage is a great actor and he makes this movie great! All the women were very odd and I didn't enjoy the parts with just them in it. When they show the pilot for the last time that scared the crap out of me!!!!!! I think they could have done more to the very last part of the movie.

I would like to comment on the fact that the movie portrays pagans women pagans as evil and they hate men...that is not true....The Wiccan Rede is " Harm None Do What Ye Will" ....reminds me of a movie called "The Lottery" And I say UKKKK on any religion that uses human sacrifice...THAT IS JUST WRONG!! I just hope anyone that sees the movie and are not educated on Paganism and Our Mother Goddess does not let this movie sway them in wrong thinking wow I have to write ten lines and this is really all I had to say...I definitely like Nicholas Cage movies for the most part...I am not going to say it was awful like some of the comments...I will have to watch the original.

I have been wanting to see this movie since I saw the first preview. I watched it New Year's eve night. I expected it to be great. It wasn't even good. The whole thing was confusing. I was waiting for it to come together and it never does. When the movie was over...I couldn't believe it. I was sure I missed something. On the DVD I rented there were two different endings one on each side. I watched them both. They didn't differ much and neither one made sense. The preview for this movie does not portray what the actual movie was like. I was very disappointed. I am glad that I did not go see it at the theater. I would not recommend this movie.

Having the main character burned alive an event that spells victory for all those psychopathic females made me absolutely furious. I would've loved to see him shoot that b**** and then bury a bullet in all the rest- I would've felt as vindicated as he would. This is the one movie that I would absolutely support having the good guy win- but it doesn't happen. It made me so angry that I wanted to punch the next girl I saw in the face.The worst part is that it was a good movie until the last two minutes. Awful. Im glad I didn't spend any money on it or else I might have really hit someone.

column4: Trivia and more detailed scenes in US version?
column5: Did anyone notice any other links to the original so far all I have is: 1. Edward Woodward's photograph is on a police Missing poster in the police station.2. The more obvious the girl who is missing is called Rowan Woodward after good old Ed.Did the American version have a scene which included Nicolas Cage's legs being broken and being stung in the face in the British version we heard the sounds but not the images. Until after it is done and he is carried in a brown sack. The swells on the face make it look as though he has been stung?

Being honest I cann't say anything good about the movie. It was a boring bad paced horrendusly acted flat and empty experience. Reaching the end of this film is one of the most dificult things i've done in my life. It's shameful how disrespectful it can be to the original version. I wish I could say something good about it. Don't waste your time.

column4: A great movie for people with short attention spans.
column5: if buy halfway through the movie your mind is already moved on to something else like dinner or if you made sure to turn off your headlights when you parked this is your movie! it was practically a tale of two halves with the only consistent tone being poor directed. The story as it plays out is actually quite entertaining as your trying to piece the mystery together with the lead character. However when you are shown random shots of random objects you are sort of forced to already foresee what will happen for the most part.*spoiler warning* I mean come on how about the early scene when he killed a bee and mentioned he was allergic? and when he unpacked his items and we were shown his bee sting survival kit. All these things were very shoved down our throats if even for contextual rather then foreshadowing keys *end spoiler* But after what was becoming an inviting tale and building on suspense the film suddenly plummets with random events that never really come together to relate to any other manner of the story. After this drop where you have to question what the movie is doing and where it is suddenly trying to go it tries though feebly to pick up the pace one more at least upping the tempo and trying to get the audience to reach some conclusion.....the end result is a non climatic twist drawn out and unneeded to the point i had actually wished i stopped the movie about 12 minutes before the end credits came up.In short they took a great classic took an incredible cast and even a good concept and failed to deliver. It seems like a third grade book report you started at first and then put off until it was duemaybe reading a few cliff notes; and here the directer was still trying for a passing grade writing the book report on the bus.
